text: I'm staying at the hotel so I thought I'd give it a try. Hip atmosphere overall. I had a nice lunch with a view of downtown. I had the chop salad made with locally grown greens, pepitas, cotija cheese and grilled chicken. Good size portion enough for two. It was tasty and fresh. I also have the deviled eggs which were beautifully presented. Not really the traditional flavor but still pretty good. I'm curious to try their dinner now.
Awesome happy hour, very well crafted drinks, love the old fashion and Juan is my favorite bar tender!! pork belly sliders are delish as are the shishito peppers. :) great atmosphere.

Went to Blue Hound a couple of nights ago for the first time with friends.  The hotel and restaurant had a cool and hip atmosphere.  We were seated promptly at our reservation time and the place was not crowded.  Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable and recommended several things on the menu including the special which was soft shell crab over an artichoke coulis with fiddlehead fern.  I ordered the special (and a shot of gazpacho) and the others at the table ordered a flatbread pizza and tater tots (yum!), the salmon, and the chicken.  When the salmon came out, it was such a tiny portion and my friend commented on it.  I had an option of ordering one or two crabs with my dinner and I opted for one after asking our server if it would be plenty of food.  I should have ordered two.  The food at Blue Hound is creative, ubber fresh, and delicious.  However, we all left still feeling hungry due to the small portion sizes.  We talked about ordering more food but the items are quite pricey and our bill was already over $100 without tip (only two of us had an alcoholic drink).  We eat out frequently at all of the new hip and trendy places that are opening all over Phoenix and feel that with all the other restaurants who are now offering creative farm to table food at  lower prices and larger (yet reasonably sized) portions, Blue Hound has some adjusting to do.  It would be a tough sell to get me to go back unless I knew our bellies would be full and our bill not so high.

Wow, I am impressed.  The bartenders are always amazing.  The manager was very flexible and accomidating for my larger group of friends. Their happy hour blows my hair back every time and the twist on a traditional old fashion was superb. :)

By far the BEST pineapple upside down cake I have EVER had. The ambiance of this restaurant is extremely modern and sleek. Overall I really enjoyed my experience at Blue Hound and will definitely be back soon to try more food!

I was so excited when they built The Hotel Palomar at City Scape. I love the sustainable concept and reused materials and art that make it so unique.  The blue hound kitchen is a very hipster and very kool. Joe and I went there on our date night a few weeks back. I don't know the bartenders name but his handle bar mustache was fantastic I loved his style. This guy was absolutely talented. He wasn't your run of the mill cheesy bartender you normally run into out here. The drinks were awesome and unique... Joe ordered an oaxacan punch he loved it. next time we go we are trying the smith and wesson.

OMG my friend albert loves this place. He says its the bomb diggity fo shizzle. If you go to downtown phoenix and can only do one thing you better go to the blue hound. Peace out yo!!!

Btw! Theres a pool that they people jump into every monday night. Geronimo!!

Holiday gathering with family and friends.  We hit Blue Hound before we went to Lucky Strike - great combination. Drinks at BH was second to none (lemonade and Jack, ahhhh).  We sat at the bar first: bartenders were helpful and went out of their way to create the drink we wanted. Fantastic.  We sat inside (must say the patio looked off the hook) and enjoyed ordering 7-8 appetizers to share among all.  I think the appetizers are comparable to the entrees as far as variety.  Not sure the waiter was too happy about a table ordering just appetizers - but oh well, we are the patrons, right ??  Definitely be back.  

One more thing that was great - they validated parking in the underground garage.  Yes!!  No nickel and dimming here....

Really liking the vibe here.  I like how the bar and lobby start to blend with a full house.  It is definitely a cocktail joint and the beer on tap continues to grow.  Have been about twice a week since they opened.

The food offers a wide variety to choose from and I like that many of the apps and entrees are created for a sharing environment. I've worked my way thru the menu pretty quickly.  Here's some suggestions:

*Starters*
Tater Tots
Deviled Eggs
Warm Mixed Nuts
Citrus Olives

Roasted Beets
Heirloom Tomato Salad (Tasty, but 3 slices was not worth the price)

*Main Dishes*
Mac N Chees
Short Ribs 
   (The gravy boat dish is cool, but the rib needs to be cut into smaller pieces)

*Dessert*
Cheese Cake with Tortilla Ice Cream
   I'm not the biggest fan of dairy, but Tortilla Ice Cream is great!

All in all, I'm happy with the cocktails and apps at any hour.  You do pay for the upscale environment to be downtown, but I feel it's worth the experience.  The elevated view out of the windows is a spectacular over the city.

The biggest perk is you can head upstairs to Lustre's rooftop bar for a night cap.  You'll see a lot of the same staff working both bars.

I recommend for anyone especially the Scottsdale crowd before catching a game

Great place for happy hour.  Came in with some coworkers on Thursday and had a great time.  Rob makes the best Old Fashion I've ever had. Greg made one of my coworkers a Lawless and they loved it as well.  Definitely going to make this a regular stop.
Great food, though a bit pricey.  I especially loved the pork belly kimchi sliders.

Went to Blue Hound for brunch today and I left  disappointed. I ordered the the brioche french toast ($12) and received one piece of toast that was marginal at best. If I am paying $12 for a piece of toast it better be exceptional, which was not at the case here. My husband ordered the spanish omelette which was decent, both portion size and taste wise, but the taste was still nothing great. His biggest complaint was that his coffee was not offered to be refilled one time. Service wasn't terrible but it was lacking, just as the food was. I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately I won't be going back.

Good food and great service! We stopped in about 1/2 hour before the kitchen was going to close.  The menu was really intriguing, and set up so that you can order and share small plates.  We enjoyed the Kale Caesar, Roasted Cauliflower, and a flat bread.  We also had a delicious Chocolate Creme Brulee for dessert.  The atmosphere is really appealing and our waiter was helpful and friendly. We'd definitely go here again!

This is a really neat spot, despite it being in a hotel. The bar and restaurant area are upscale and the Manhattans will make you slap ya mama! We had the BLT with fried green tomatoes....the way to go...and their 4 cheese Flatbread (on special) was on point! Very crispy and thin...loved it. The martinis were a bit small, but packed a punch. Prohibition era drinks was a nice concept. 

This is a good place to go when there is an event. It won't be as crowded as the other places that are easier to find...
Excellent shrimp and grits, great beer selection,  nice ambiance for a small group. Lots of great new competition, but Blue Hound holds its own.

This is really hard for me to right because I love their cocktails so very much. They are unique and different (one of their drinks they came out with a glass of tobacco smoke to infuse with their whiskey cocktail). My only issue I had was that they only had one bartender working on a Saturday night, though he was excellent service was a bit slow for a Saturday night. All and all I will still come back.

I've eaten here 3 times (2 times for dinner, once for breakfast) and can't wait to go back.  The shishito peppers are fantastic, but so are the small farm cheeses, tater tots, and deviled eggs.  On a recommendation from our server the first time, I ordered the short ribs.  The meat just fell off the bone.  As much as I loved those, I tried the lamb meatballs the 2nd time there.  After the first bite, I was disappointed I didn't order the larger portion.  The service there was impressive and extremely helpful.  As a whisky drinker, my Brown Derby and Manhattan's were delightful.

Nice comfortable place--itis what we need.  I think the service was slow and they need to improve on that.   First we had the pate.  It was ok a little dry and plalin.   The bread that was served with it was too hard.
We had the trout-which was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of spice.  My partner had the rositto which was great.  He also had the ceviche.  The ceviche was way too bland like the pate.  Maybe they are being careful on the spices.  It has only been open a few days so they need a chance to work out the bugs.
If you like your food on the bland side you will enjoy the food.

We had friends come into town for a visit. We took them to Blue Hound for lunch. We had an amazing experience!  The food was great and fresh. My son had the BHKC BLT. It was amazing with green fried tomatoes.  I had the crab cake sandwich with a salad. The service was awesome also. They were friendly and fast with their services. We highly recommend the Blue Hound!

Mixed reviews- great drinks and super convenient to the Palomar hotel, but food was so-so. My bone in bass was marginal, but my husband's Kobe beef rib was spectacular! My daughter-in-law struggled through a bone in salmon steak that was not worth the trouble or the money. Dessert was amazing and we were delighted with the extensive after dinner drink options. We would try it again but I would steer clear of the fish next time the restaurant was basically empty but they were out of 2 of the main courses. Room for improvement but good.

Stopped in for a drink and some food and was instantly greeted by the friendly bar tender Bobby. I wasn't sure what cocktail I wanted but I knew I liked gin. He mixed me up a cocktail that not only looked great but tasted great as well! I came in a little before they opened and bobby made sure to make me feel comfortable at the bar while I waited for them to open. I will surely be back!

I don't like writing these type of reviews: If only a restaurant would live up to it's decor and menu-writing, Blue Hound would be a hit. Unfortunately, the food and the service didn't live up to the hype. But in response to all of the four and five-star reviews, there needs to be a dose of reality here, folks. Did we eat the same food?

Let's start with the good: the restaurant is dazzlingly hip, filled with beautiful people accented by only the most sophisticated lighting, and filled with the energetic buzz that set our expectations high. My first thought? "This will be a home run!"

I ate there with a group of foodie friends, all of whom were salivating with excitement to try what appeared to be a innovative and tasty menu. And it's received all this positive press; the media is always right...right?

For appetizers, we ordered the Endless Caramel Popcorn (poorly popped kernels seasoned with a non-nuanced avalanche of ancho chile. Where was the butterscotch flavor?) The Tater Tots were underwhelming, and the dip tasted like potato soup out of the can. The Hickman's Farm Deviled Eggs were the one shining moment of the entire meal, with an excellent balance of flavors and textures. 

I ordered Bob's Indian Red Peaches salad, for my entree, and was surprised with a very scantily-filled rectangular plate containing a small smattering of peaches, marcona almonds, a tidy--and tiny--pile of pepper cress greens and a few tiny lumps of fromage blanc. The peaches were delicious, but overall, it was all presentation and no substance. 

Also ordered was the Ancho Chile Braised Pork Neck which was a soupy concoction with ...er... no apparent sign of pork in it. For $17, Blue Hound, feel free to include a speck of meat. Just sayin.' 

When the 4" wide crock of Mac n' Cheese was set down in front of us (mind you--this is considered an "entree") we almost had to giggle at it's diminutive size. Tell me, when one orders mac n' cheese, are they feeling like nibbling on a sample-size portion? I think not. Fail.

Hopes always remain high for dessert, so we ordered with gusto: A few cake n' shakes (the Nutella shake was dismal, and the chocolate cake bites tasted on par with Costco bakery goods), Lemon Blueberry Cheese Cakes (or should they be called tubes? The cheesecake was served in a bewildering tube shape, plopped unappetizingly on a bed of granola and blueberries. Not lovely, but odd.), and an order of the most dry, flavorless mound of Carmelized Pineapple Upside Down Cake ever put into my mouth. It was so bad, I had lost the heart to finish it.

In summary, if you want to blow a few hundred bucks on a lackluster, mediocre and disappointing meal that pretends to be so much more, the Blue Hound is for you. It's a shame.

Been here several times. Brunch was unimpressive, lunch was solid, happy hour is  great and dinner was down right delicious. Also the cocktails are made with care, premium ingredients and creativity. I'd highly recommend the "lawless" whiskey and tobacco bitters and served in a glass full of vanilla tobacco smoke. I would also highly recommend the risotto croquettes, short ribs and deviled eggs. A few reviews claim this place is expensive, if your worried about that, trot on over to the tilted quilt next door or chipotle across the street.

I visited this place last week on my first visit to Arizona. By far the best mixed cocktails I have ever had.  I work at a hotel/restaurant in Bakersfield, CA which is the same style theme as this place. The female bartender was very friendly and helpful with my future wife and me. The short rib sliders were delicious, but the house mixed cocktails were out of this world good. When I come back to Arizona, I'm definitely going to stay at this hotel, because it is WELL worth the money. Thanks for all the hospitality great ambiance.

Another great Phoenix restaurant. I had dinner one night while attending a conference. I ordered the shrimp and grits. It was very tasty with a little kick, but not overly spicy. The English Mule is refreshing and a nice twist on the Moscow Mule. We ate outside on the patio and had a great experience. Dessert was the chocolate cake with in house banana ice cream and caramel. One of my colleagues had lunch there and said the bourbon/scotch menu and associated drinks are impressive.

Popped in for brunch after arriving in town for a conference. The salad was good, but not great. But you had me at "bottomless mimosas." Staff were friendly and helpful, service was good, atmosphere was great.
My wife I came here for the first time today. The food is different which is what we like. Good food! Good bloody Mary's! Good Service!
Great "comfort food". The pork shank is phenomenal (and huge!) and literally falls off the bone. The cheddar/bacon burger is perhaps the best burger I've had in the past year.
Awesome and unique in Phoenix for ambiance alone.  The service was on point and perfectly staffed.   Very friendly staff.  Excellent food

What a great experience we had when we dined at the blue hound on May 5th, 2015. The food was beautifully presented yet still relaxed. The service by Jeremy was outstanding. He was clearly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food he was serving. 

Each dish was delicious and interesting. The shrimp with creamy grits sets the standard for this somewhat trendy dish. I will have a hard time ordering it any where else now! The beet salad with dates was beautiful and we'll composed in nice bite size pieces that made it easy to get all the flavors in one bite, a detail often overlooked when form takes precedence over flavor. 

We will go back soon to try the many other dishes we wished we had room for!

Great job Blue Hound. A howling good eatery!

I bring my wife here for cocktails on special occasions and it has been a great experience. On this visit I was told my wife's drink (dark and stormy) was served in a Collins glass due to the on going theft  of the copper mugs normally used to present the drink, and the ginger beer that they made in-house was very time intensive and that they now use a mix. Needless to say I will be looking for a establishment that cares about making a $10.00 cocktail that they can present with out excuses.

Great place. Warm atmosphere. Loved the tapas style plates. This place had my vote from the beginning, since they had Odell on tap. The bartender was impressive trying to offer his input on pairing a beer with our food options. We will definitely be back!

The atmosphere is great...the food is not so great- a little bit too experimental and not quite getting it right. The tater tots are the only thing I'd order again. No to the flapjacks, the cornbread salad combo, and the red snapper. Maybe next time, l'll just come for cocktails like others recommended...

Luster is on the 3rd floor. Not sure why I couldn't find it on Yelp but its a cool spot. Pool is within arm's reach and the roof top bar offers small bites and drinks.  I had the luster burger which was grass fed and my wife had the turkey flat bread. The burger was excellent... a little over cooked although. Flat bread was nothing special but the ambience was great and I would go back especially during the spring and earlier in the day... brunch and mimosas would be amazing on a warm sunny day. My only other critique is to wipe down the table... The stains were noticeable and that is not representative of a Kimpton property. Happy dining! James

I admit, I have been a bad Yelp citizen, always using, never contributing ratings.  But the last two nights at The Blue Hound have forced my hand.  For our weekend getaway at the Palomar, we decided to try the hotel restaurant the first night. We went all in, having the "Chef and Bar Squad Geek Out" tasting menu.  Wow.

We had terrific service from our server (forgot his name), and personal visits from Adrienne (or Cheyenne?), the GM.  The chef even tailored our selections for my wife's selective palate (no seafood, nothing raw).  Then he personally delivered and described each amazing course.  And the pairings from the bar were perfect.  Our favorite was the spiced up version of a Singapore Sling.  A great evening.

The next night, we had reservations at a neighboring restaurant, The Arrogant Butcher, mainly because of their prime rib special.  We were joined by my dad, and seated just before 7.  After we ordered an appetizer, we were informed that they were out of prime rib.  It was a game day, but one would think with the evening booked through 9 PM with reservations, they would still have had their special at 7 PM.

We left, quite disappointed, with our evening plans a mess.  Then, in a stroke of genius, my wife suggested a return to The Blue Hound.

As soon as we met our server, Zach, we knew the evening would be turning around.  My wife and dad decided to split "One Big A$$ Steak", a 36 oz porterhouse, with cast iron scalloped potatoes.  I asked for a half order of the pork belly sliders.

The chef, upon hearing of our disappointing evening, didn't want us to wait for food.  So he sent out a complimentary tater tots appetizer (amazing) followed by an interesting roasted corn on the cob (also delicious).  My wife and father asked for repeats of the spiced up Singapore Sling. I had a Hendrick's gimlet, which the bartender perfected with muddled cucumber (staying clear of lime at my request).

The night was already saved, and then the entrees arrived.  My steak loving wife and my dad LOVED the porterhouse, grilled to perfection.  And just to go even one more step above and beyond, the chef sent me the full order of sliders, because he didn't want me to be jealous of the huge steak.  Over the top.

I have to go with five stars.  This was greatness in all aspects.  We can't wait to return!

While in Phoenix for a conference in October, a group of us came here for dinner with reservations. We were accommodated with two rows of tables for about 20-30 people. The servers attended to us rather well. Great service so far.

When it came time to order, I asked for the Seafood Chowda. A few of my colleagues ordered the shortribs. When my food came, I was disappointed that the "chowda" barely had any broth in it. Probably two tablespoons worth. It had a good amount of mussels and a couple of clams. There were a few thin slices of tiny potatoes and that was it. Being a fan of hot and spicy foods I was expecting a little kick from the ghost chile. To my disappointment, all I tasted was salt. The food was very salty and not a trace of spice. I even asked the waiter when I ordered how spicy is it and was told that it had a good kick. I gave a mussel to someone to try and he agreed to the saltiness and no spice. When the server came around again, I asked if this is how it was supposed to be prepared and he said yes. I pointed out the lack of any broth, creamy or otherwise and he just shrugged his shoulders. 

Other people in my party were disappointed as well. The short ribs did not even have a hint of blue cheese. And this was coming from a person who loves cheese and is also a chef.

Sadly, many of us walked out at the end of our dinner very disappointed. We found this place to be over-priced and over-hyped. We concluded that there was little effort to please us due to the large size of the group which guaranteed their gratuity. 

It's sad that the only thing some of us enjoyed was the popcorn. My advice: review the menu carefully and ask a lot of questions. I most likely will not come back here the next time I'm in Phoenix.
The Sea Bass was exquisite!  Perfect combination of flavors. By far was the wonderful service from James!!

The dining space is very well done and true to what one expects in a Kimpton property.  The cocktail menu is diverse and rather notable in its imaginative mixtures.  The wait staff was attentive and informative.  The menu has a wide variety.  And the food is delicious!  The downside to all of this is the cost.  I have never paid so much for so little.  The quality of the fare does not outweigh the sticker shock here.  The best I can do is give this a 3-star rating because of the pricing. 5 teeny-tiny tacos for $15?  And I do mean teeny-tiny.   The KFQuail is fantastic but you 3X more cornbread than quail.  And the gravy is outstanding.  But there is so little of it there (the quail, that is).  And at $17 no less.  Roasted beet salad and a roasted peach salad for $12 each?  There is barely a half-serving in each.  Don't go by their online menu either because it is out of date in regards to what is offered and what is being charged.  Nearly every item is at least $2 more than shown online.  The best value on the menu are the baby zucchini corn dogs.  

5 small dishes, 2 drinks and tip left us $100 poorer.  Great food, lousy value.
We stopped in for a birthday dinner. Carolina was an amazing server and was very knowledgeable, really awesome experience

First meal here and loved it. Started off with the tater tots with pork, the zucchini corn dogs and the sopes. All vey good. Sopes my fav by far. For dinner the trout and Kentucky fried  quail. Again both very good. Also had the Tommy's Margarita - good.  Asked our server Blake for a recommendation for a second drink, he asked what i liked and he said he had the perfect drink. Came back w/ pineapple, beer, tequila combo, WOW, very good!   Nice location, downtown has another great place to come to.

A Foodie Delight

This is my third time at Blue Hound and haven't been dissapointed yet. Being across from US Airways Center and the ballpark make this one of the top choices before an event. The Pork Belly sliders are my go to for every trip.  It is a great place to taste a few different things when you are with a group.  Our server this time was Caleb and helped us narrow down our selections.  And though Sangria is not on their menu (it should be) they whipped a very tasty one up for me.  The only negative thing I could come up with is the noise level.  It is a fun place to be but the acoustics can make it a little hard to hear.

Evening stated off horrible. Had reservations, didn't get seated and dealt with a rude bartender and beyond rude customers while we waited. Spoke to the manager, he got us seated immediately and from that point on, our service was impeccable. Our server, the manager, and the food were fabulous. We will definitely be back.
This is my new favorite watering hole downtown. The cocktails are delicious and the staff are attentive. Only wish I lived closer

I wanted to find a neat place downtown for a friends 30th birthday. I used Yelp's "New and Hot" search in the area and found Blue Hound Kitchen. I liked the menu and location so decided to try as the ratings were good. I was beyond impressed. I have eaten all over the world and in extremely nice restaurants but Blue Hound Kitchen's service was out-of-this-world. I had booked the reservations for 5 through opentable and made a little note about the birthday. They called to confirm and when I spoke about the birthday and dessert possibilities she was very accomodating. I had mentioned also my friend was gluten and dairy free. Upon arriving the staff had not only pulled a menu and highlighted the items upon it that were gluten and dairy free for her but then also had placed a birthday card signed by the entire staff on top! They referred to her by name and really made the whole dinner seem so special! It was almost like dining with family! I was so impressed with this service and cannot even begin to thank them enough for making it such a special evening! If you have special occassions this is the place to celebrate it. The food was fun and tasty (I'm sure most of the other reviews below go into detail on that). It's right across the street from Stand Up Live also so being able to make it a full evening out is also handy. I will definitely be visiting this place again!

After you've fought your way here through the labyrinth beyond the goblin city, found an underground parking space, avoided the pitfalls of construction and ventured to the second floor entrance... be sure to present your ticket for validation at the desk!

We had a birthday (not mine) outing here, and I have many good things to say! Strong cocktails! Intriguing flavors! Moody and inviting setting! Our waiter did forget to grab drink orders from the last 2 (of 9) people at our table - one of us had a half drink so maybe he was misled. He made up for the lapse with anecdotes and consistently attentive service thereafter. 

We were in a corner, which we filled with laughter, and it was loud but not so loud that (being in the middle) I couldn't turn and hear what the other end of the table was chatting about.

There was something for everyone on the menu, even shortribs served on the bone, in a bowl, over tasty sides (for the Viking/Caveman in you). I had the risotto - full of flavor - and the olives and bottomless popcorn were big hits... but the tacos, the tacos! It was the only sign of sadness from our group, that the full order of tacos wasn't really a meal, but more of a tapas plate.

Oh, and water carafes should probably just have been left at the table. It's shwank to fill a glass halfway from a glass bottle, but for those of us who work in the Arizona heat and rely on rehydrating in the evening... waiting for water to arrive (again) is anything but neat-o.

BUT! before you're done, save room for a digestif up at the rooftop bar. It's lovely, too.
Kinda dead on a Friday. More people should come down its got a nice atmosphere. Good beers good spirits semi good company.

My friends and I had just left a concert Saturday night when we decided to go out for drinks. Since we are from tucson we were not familiar with the area. We decided upon this restaurant based on the good reviews. Many times I hate asking bartenders for a drink recommendation because they more worried on how fast they can make the drinks. While we where there we were recommended the metropolitan by Michael, which was delicious! I would recommend this drink. Through out the night we also had another bartender Rob that was also very attentive. If you want a place to relax and enjoy yourself I would suggest going on a night when Michael and/Rob are working! Had a blast!

Alright, you're ballsy enough Blue Hound. The food had gotten a lot better here. The menu always looked good before but didn't seem to deliver. It's not bad, little pricey compared to some meals for the same price. The booths are incredibly comfortable and I don't mind paying $10 for strong cocktails. I'm cool with it.

Unable to review this place nor do I think I want to. Left 2 messages, sent an email for a large party reservation. No one has called or emailed back. Customer service is always one of my top 3 when reviewing or recommending. So far, F.

A friend and I and our daughters were attending an event downtown and decided to try this. Brunch was all they were serving so my friend and I ordered the Spanish omelette. We split it because we were told the portions were big. They are plenty big, but we didn't even finish it because it lacked  flavor. Neither one of us cared for it. The kids wanted corn dogs and when they were eating them we discovered that they were not fully cooked. The batter was raw all around the corn dogs. My friend and I also ordered bloody Mary's. I had 3 small sips and could not even choke any more down. It only came garnished with a lime wedge, and the flavor made me feel a little nauseous. My friend thinks there was a lot of garlic in it.......we did complain about the corn dogs and they apologized and took it off our bill and offered us free desert. We did not take them up on it, we just decided we would call it quits. Would not recommend this place.

I had a fantastic evening here! After making a reservation originally for 8, we showed up a few minutes late and only had 7 but they were completely accommodating and understanding. 

I had the Brusselsprout hash and added goat cheese (again, no complications) and it was so delicious! They refilled our drinks regularly and the staff were all polite and relaxed. 

One of my friends flatbreads came out 5 minutes later than the rest of the food, which wasn't a huge deal for us, but the manager came and apologized personally and not only comped her food but gave us a free Pineapple Upside Down Cake for the table to share! 

This was easily one of the best experiences I've had here and will always be a loyal customer! Between the interesting and tasty food, the downtown location, and the awesome decor and atmosphere, it is a definite Must every time I come home.

I went here with a group of friends for a Sunday breakfast a few weekends ago and it was a pleasant experience. We had to wait a bit for everyone to show up and there was ample, comfortable seating especially as this is connected to the hotel right next to it. The decor is very trendy and modern with a mish-mash of great furniture the comes of looking lovely. 

The selection for breakfast was a nice variation and everyone seemed to enjoy what they got. It is a bit pricey here, for example a small glass of apple juice was abut $4 but personally that's why I just stick to water wherever I go. Our waitress did seem a bit scatter-brained but the service was good. I don't normally get a chance to try out places in downtown Phoenix so I'm glad our friends suggested this place. If I had a chance to go here again I wouldn't hesitate.
Had the quinoa salad for lunch recently during a work trip. Such great flavor and great atmosphere. It was a little pricey but a delicious salad.

The atmosphere was excellent, the food was an unpleasant experience on the pallet; there were too many complex elements in the food and could not finish any of the dishes I ordered.
Maybe try it again when the menu changes
Cool ambiance. Good appetizers. Don't order the short rib unless a) you like every bite to be either fatty or dry/charred, and b) you like your grits lukewarm and creamy.

I was happy that this place was at the Kimpton Palomar hotel in Phoenix. The review is mainly on the drinks since, I only had an appetizer. That appetizer was the mac n cheese and it was scrumptious! Extra cheesey with a mixture of white cheeses, served in a petite cast iron skillet to keep it warm. 

I tried three of the drinks on tbe menu, must try the hibiscus vodka drink ladies refreshing for sure! Meet Me in Rio was good as well if you like coconut milk nice and fruity. I also had a grapefruit rum drink that had a tangy zing. This place is a must if ever in DT Phoenix.

The food is phenomenal &the staff is awesome. Downtown Phoenix has few options anyway, so it's imperative to find a great place to eat. BLUE HOUND isn't the cat's meow. It's the Blue Hound's bark! (even better, que no?)

Preface: I'd give this place 2.5 stars if that was an option. 

I met the girls for happy hour. I didn't feel like a fussy house cocktail so I ordered my standard gin & soda. Too bad they had no specials for this very basic drink ($8, I think for a single). So I ended up paying a lot more than others with their whiskey lemonades or whatever-the-heck they ordered. 

After seeing the array of HH dishes ordered by others, I settled on the Kennebac Potato Fries and Hickman Farms Deviled Eggs. Both were tasty, indulgent snacks. I loved the rosemary on the fries and the generousness of the yolk mixture in the eggs (fork and knife were essential for me and my clumsiness). 

The sliders got good reviews as well, though I didn't try them. 

Decor was enjoyable. Service could have been better, but we were sitting in the lounge area so maybe they weren't as focused on us (however, it is happy hour in a hotel...I'd think they'd be paying attention, especially during this peak time).

All and all--an okay experience, but I know I am not going out of my way to return--especially as a local. The happy hour just isn't that great of a deal (and I wish they had more food options! Not a great selection and the dinner entrees are $20+). The inconvenience of parking downtown and so-so service just adds to my Blue Hound apathy. I guess if you are downtown it's a fine option.

A friend of mine and I decided to have dinner at Blue Hound Sunday night. We figured it would be steady but slow enough to enjoy dinner.

The decor itself is amazing! Very well decorated and unique, from the lighting fixtures to the coffee tables.

The food of course, was the best part of the night. Sergio was our server, and was able to help us by explaining the drink menu and the dinner menu. He made great suggestions for both, noting that for the dinner menu, it was more tapas and family style which works best for me. Sergio was also very attentive through out the night.

The Summer of Shandies cocktail was very yummy that I might just try to replicate it at home.
We tried a number of dinner items, all which were full of different but great flavors. My favorites though, were the tomato heirloom salad, zucchini corn dogs,and  the short rib.
For dessert, I would recommend the cake n shake. the cake part is definitely sharable but the shake, too good to share :)

Both managers that were on the floor, Cheyenne and Matt, even stopped by to check how our evening was going.

For the quality and the attention to detail that is spent to create the variety of cocktails and food, the value is definitely justified.

I cannot stress enough how wonderful the service was and how delicious the food tasted.
I will definitely be back for dinner and to try out Lustre the pool bar!

I really liked the ambiance of this place. Cozy, with a great view of downtown. 
I had the seared ahi and handmade pasta. The seared ahi was delicious! The outer crusted seasoning hits the palate last, and just adds a great flavor and touch of spice, and keeps you guessing as to what it is. The quinoa and red pepper pull all the flavors together perfectly. 
The handmade pasta fell just a bit short. The tomatoes weren't a good ripe flavor, and the pasta was a little to mushy for my taste. Overall, I'd recommend this place for an overall good dining experience.

Love this place, the service is excellent and the drinks are to die for. Robert is the best bartender of the bunch. He has great suggestions for drinks if you're not sure and makes a mean rum old fashion. 
I never miss a chance to come here when I'm downtown.

The perfect first date in downtown Phoenix.

Went here with two sorority sisters after seeing The Nutcracker at Symphony Hall. It was a late dinner for a Sunday night. I ordered Tommy's Margarita and they each got a glass of red wine and sparkling champayne. The entrance to this place (located in/near City Scape) is so stunning. The waiting area has these lush, new age couches and exterior decor on the walls as wall art. It's very cool to see. We were escorted to the back dining room near the patio (which overlooks city scape and all of downtown PHX, yeah it is as amazing as you're thinking) past the bar area and group seating tables. 

I ordered the endless caramel popcorn for the table and it was such a surprise! Infused with a chile pepper, this was not your mama's caramel popcorn for sure. My sisters ordered the mushroom soup and a kale leaf caesar salad. Both had very high remarks.

For dinner we orded the New England scallops, another kale salad and duck flatbread. I can't speak for them but everything was fantastic! The scallops were so soft and had a plate of seasoned tomatoes and gac under. That made the flavor explode in your mouth.

I would totally go back here for pre-show drinks and apps. Or even on a date. It's so great.
Good food and tasty unique cocktails but VERY slow service even for drinks.

I had a friend who stayed at the Kimpton hotel that the Blue Hound is in (I hadn't heard about it prior to this weekend) and she had a dining credit at the restaurant, so we decided to check it out.  

The bad:  Our server was initially very distant and not particularly friendly. However, after looking him in the eye, saying lots of "pleases" and "thank yous" and just generally engaging him, he was so much friendlier.  The only other negative is that he seemed to get lost and didn't check back with the table often.  We would've ordered another round of drinks had he come back more often. Getting the check with difficult as well.  The I also had a friend that ordered the flatbread (not sure if it was pumpkin or sweet potato, but it was along those lines) with sage...it was a good concept, but not savory enough.

Now the good:  The server lightened up and was very sweet once he got over his initial standoffishness.  The drinks were pretty decent.  I was looking for a Moscow Mule, but the server informed me that they don't have ginger beer, but ginger simple syrup.  So we kind of improvised and it was still good.  Everyone ordered a drink off of their specialty menu and enjoyed it.  Food wise -the bottomless popcorn - YUMMY!!  And they were generous with it.  As I mentioned above, my friend ordered the flatbread - consensus at the table was that it was too sweet and not savory enough.  I ordered the trout - DELISH!!! We shared a couple of the chicory salads - pretty good...the dressing was nice and light.  Others at the table ordered the mussels and the flatbread of the night and they were all very happy.

Overall, I'd give the place another whirl...particularly for drinks!

I took my wife to this restaurant last night for her graduation along with my dad her brother, her mom and her mom's boyfriend.  I think I ruined all of them to going out to eat at other Kitchens forever.  We started with tater tots, charred pork belly sliders and the family farmed cheese plate.  I don't think anything says family dinner like reaching over each other for another delicious bite because everything is addictively good.  Up next we had the cured strawberry & fennel flat bread, crispy salt and pepper shrimp,  BBQ short ribs an added bonus was something Chef Brent whipped up was snapper on french role with a sweet jelly and citrus aioli.   I would have never thought white fish and jelly would go together but I was so very wrong.  For desert with had their pineapple upside down cake with date ice cream, chocolate Crème Brûlée, and finally the strawberry shortcake served in a jar.  This is my first review I have ever felt the need to write and I think that I need to work on my description because I certainly cannot describe the amazing flavors appropriately with words.  What I can do is encourage you to find out for yourself and enjoy every minute of it.

We ordered a quesadilla, burger, desert gin fizzy and a buffalo trace cocktail for room service. Burger was only available cooked well. Two patties, nice char but one patty cooked to order would have been juicier. There was too much stuff to actually masticate the thing without jaw fatigue setting in. But super tasty. I took it apart and had enough stuff for two respectable burgers. 

Quesadilla  was made with chèvre. Again, tasty, but lack of gluey cheese left the thing falling apart and mushy. Nicely seasoned though. Very mild almost undetectable flavor in the salsa. The gin drink tasted like creosote, the rain-triggered aroma that AZ natives know and love. I found this interesting but not sure I want to drink my creosote? Not decided yet, but it is a cool idea. I was impressed with the value here -- nothing totally bizarre like you can get with hotel restaurants and not overpriced. Pretty good.
Excellent food and drinks!  Manager Zach Harte helped make it a great experience for us as 3 sisters waited for Springsteen!!
Celebrated my boyfriend's birthday Here and the drinks were amazing!  I highly recommend the shrimp and grits...also if you want to make the most of the experience, ask for james!

The bottom line with discretionary spending, which eating out represents, is value. We don't indulge in this luxury a lot. So each experience matters. The Blue Hound offers real value. We enthusiastically recommend Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails. Here's why.

My wife and I recently took our dear friends and neighbors to the Blue Hound to celebrate a birthday. They had never been there. We will all be back (no surprise to us). A thank you call the next morning said: "Dave had a grand time last night!" That was the point.

As always, the food was outstanding in all respects: presentation, taste, value, and service. To the latter point, our server was Ryan. He does a superb job of making his guests welcome, with just the right balance of politeness, knowledge, attention without being overbearing, and sensitivity to the mood of the experience. He clearly knows and respects the quality offered from the kitchen and the bar and that made us comfortable with each of us customizing our orders. Yes, we all had different entrees and they were outstanding.

A real experience for the guys was the amazing Lawless cocktail. Ryan put us on to it and we just had to try it. Astounding! Just that would be worth a visit to the Blue Hound. 

We went early on a Sunday evening--a good choice if you want a quieter, more low-key experience. Noise levels were non-existent and, of course, the staff's attention was more easily obtained. But we have been there during quite busy times and the quality of their offerings did not suffer in the least. Noise levels are up then, as they are in most restaurants at such times.

One of our friends is a design professional; his wife is a design genius. My wife and I are neither, but we have over 50 years of experience in creating a contemporary living environment. One of the things that made our friends' first experience here so special is the exceptional attention to design detail in the space; the use of wood, metal, glass and lighting all combine to indicate that someone really cared to make this space so inviting.

Parking is validated; a convenience. Total cost: $3!

Came here for brunch and bottomless mimosas. Ordered "eggs Benny". Ended up with egg (singular) Benny with an eye dropper of hollandaise sauce and enough crab to cover the tip of my finger. Ambiance was good. Waited forever to get a pen to sign the bill. Finally had to get up and ask the hostess so that we could leave. The bar does look nice but I'm not sure why people are giving 5 stars. Maybe we struck out, maybe the drinks are amazing...I don't know.

Expensive for what you get!  I ordered a flatbread pizza, $14.  Came with No Sides.  It might as well have been just bread.  There was really no sauce, topping or cheese on the thing.  For $14 + tax + slow service when it wasn't busy, I think I will spend my money elsewhere. This was my first visit to this restaurant and last.

This is the third time that we went to the restaurant and I have to say whoever hires people here now needs to get fired. HORRIBLE service. Hostess has no idea what she is doing and let's get real she's not performing brain surgery here. We decided to sit at the bar and only two seats were open, both of which the bartender was saving for his friends. What a mess.
Perfect addition to downtown... Best margaritas, flatbread was superb and the service as superior.   Leave it to Kimpton to do it up right; very nicely done and we will be back many times over!
It's a great downtown staple. Food and drinks are consistently well done. Menus changes with enough frequency to keep it interesting. Atmosphere is nice.  Doesn't feel like a hotel resturant.

Well I have to give Blue Hound the fifth star for the service, atmosphere and of course the food.  We went with the chef's choice four course menu. Everything was perfect but I especially loved the double cut pork chop. Can't wait to return

Stopped in with a few friends one night for after dinner drinks and some snacks. Bartender was wonderful and was able to get us everything that we needed even know it was very late in the hour. A lot of personalized attention, and seem to really value our patronage.

First night in Phoenix was spent at the Blue Hound. Great wine selection and cocktail menu: I tried a red from Oregon and hubby had a daiquiri. Food was great, for starters we got some amazing high-end tater tots, two words: harissa sauce. I had a flatbread with olives, grapes, peppers and feta for my main course (which I enjoyed so much that I tried to replicate it once I flew back home) and hubby had the pork belly, which came in a cast-iron dish. We were so full that we skipped dessert, but the menu looked promising.  Service was attentive and pleasant and I really enjoyed the modern, pub-like atmosphere.

I came here for a business dinner meeting. Overall I was very impressed. The interior decor was modern classic flair with a rustic feel to it just to start. It has several options for space of you wanted to talk as a group privately or at an open table. 
We had several options that I posted pictures of but the stand outs were fried oysters and ahi tuna for staters. For entrees the Cajun style craw fish and rice the best dish around followed by the pork shank on a bed of risotto. 
We had the compliment of two bottles of wine that was stellar, Justin obviously a favorite from our central coast of CA followed by the Malbec which was the stellar on their selection as well. The best part of why this place deserves 5 stars is their service and price point . Most stellar entrees are in the low to mid 20s and top shelf wine in the 60s . Such great value even though we didn't pay for dinner . Top notch and my kind of place for a professional meal in a more laid back setting
Great find! Must have the tater tots and try one of their unique cocktails recommended by James. Next time I'm in Phoenix I'll be sure to go back!!
I currently went there for Valentine's dinner with my husband. I enjoyed their 5 course meal except the fish I had was a bit over cook and no taste but other than that everything was great!

Christmas day  Brunch  Disappointment:
I must admit I was looking forward to this as I am new to the area   I have been a chef with 3 degrees in Culinary Arts.  And over 35 years in the industry.  I called to inquire about the brunch the day before  I was told their would be a waffle station  along with many other items  the cost was at 37 dollars per person. $$$$$ I thought this to be reasonable  as it was Christmas morning. Our reservation was for 11:15 AM   we arrived on time. The  employees were pleasant.  The restaurant  was for the most part empty.  We walked over to the buffet  the items included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and fried potatoes, cold smoked salmon, bagels, Danish, and sliced assorted fruit,  a hot continental breakfast at best. Their was no waffle station  no omelette station as I was told there would be when I called the restaurant the day before. No lunch items at all   so I could not understand why they billed this as a brunch when it should have been billed as just a breakfast//  Needless to say that for over $120 dollars for a party of three,  we were quite disappointed.

Drinks: Good. I like the different flavors. It must have been a good bartender cause i felt it was worth my $9. I'd come here just to get a drink anytime.

Main Meal: Boyfriend and I got the steaks.  But we both really thought the steaks were just "okay." Not too memorable. The heirloom tomato panzanella topping didn't seem balance out well with the steak flavors or something? Of course the balsamic worked though.

Decided to check out all the hype - not bad. First observation is that the hotel lobby (which is the way I opted to enter the restaurant - I did not notice the exterior door) is probably the most unimpressive that I have ever seen. You struggle for a moment to get your bearings - then you catch sight of the venue.

Place is sort of hip - but it fails in my mind to convey an ambiance where you would be inclined to spend 3 to 4 hours of your evening "soaking" it up. Has more of a "grab a drink and find the next place" feel. Once I got by that, I settled in and enjoyed the food.

Menu is limited and it tries a little too hard to be cool. Food we had was good but not memorable.

It is one of the many new eateries in the general Phoenix downtown area, specifically the City Scape area. It will likely fair well simply because of the proximity to the Kimpton Palomar Hotel - convenience will be its underpinning.

Will be back to give it another try. Maybe happy hour.

The Blue Hound... This has quickly become my go-to spot for cocktails and appetizers. Everything is meticulously on point and delivered with efficiency and grace. This would be an excellent start (or end) to any romantic evening. Just be sure to make reservations well in advance if you plan on sitting on the patio. It fills up fast. 

The Kimchi pork belly sliders are absolutely to die for and pair excellently with a smoky martini with a twist of lemon. 

Featuring fare for all manner of diets, be it vegan, paleo, gluten free and the like, this place is without a doubt a crowd-winning example of haute cuisine. We Phoenicians are proud.

I'm a foodie and a discerning customer. I enjoy many of the qualities of a restaurant that aims to be a finer-end establishment, such as this one, but I can equally enjoy a hole-in-the-wall if the food and service are good.  This restaurant had neither.

 - Incompetence -
I just had an evening here with a large group.  The management was very professional, as was our waiter in tending to our guest's needs.  Several things went wrong, however, and the food is just not good.  We ordered plates of the fries and aioli for the table.  One friend is severely lactose-intolerant, so we asked that fries be provided without the cheese.  Finally, 20+ minutes later his fries arrived, but still with cheese.  His entre later in the evening also had cheese he asked not to be included.

 - Overrated Drink Options -
It's true there is an encyclopedic drink menu, although most the options are overpriced for what you get.  When I was waiting for friends at the bar before our meal, the bartender was rude and stopped filling my order halfway through to talk to her coworker for several minutes.

- Horrible food -
Let me cut to the chase on this one.  I ordered the lamb meatballs. I got a full entre. They were inedible.  The lamb apparently died in a pepper mill explosion. I should have sent the dish back but we were already behind schedule on the rest of our evening, and I couldn't wait for them to correct the problem.  I can't think of the last time I ate something that was so horrible I couldn't bear to finish it. I like almost anything.

There were other problems with the food.  The greens in my salad had spoiled.  Many other guests did not enjoy there meals.  It's true that most of the entres are overpriced, so they offer "medium" sized or tapas options. This is just pretentious.  If your entre was decent enough to eat, customers won't mind paying more.  Several people ordered the salmon full entre and it was a thinly-sliced piece of barely cooked salmon on a plate.  The food all came in stupid iron pans that are too small to reach in and cut your meat with a knife.

- Checks -
For our dozens guests or so, our polite waiter was not polite enough to allow us to charge the bill to separate credit cards. I don't know how you're supposed to pay a $500 bill in cash among so many people. We should have brought a cpa to tabulate our invoice.  The waiter did include his 20% gratuity, thankfully.

In conclusion, skip this restaurant.

You know what I love? I love it when you decide to try a new, kinda pricey restaurant, and they just KNOCK IT outta the park! Blue Hound was such an exceptional experience on Wednesday evening, that I went back on Thursday. What else do you need to know, right?

With a funky but upscale relaxed atmosphere, the Blue Hound compliments the Kimpton Palomar hotel in which it resides. If you've stayed at a Kimpton, then you know that they have a great understanding of what's important, and what's not. Is the decor in this place a little jumbled? Absolutely. Are the servers simply first class? You betcha.

Oh yeah, the food...   ;)   The first funny thing you'll notice about the Blue Hound is the menu - the left page has a bunch of food dishes listed, but the right page... hmmm, this looks like ALL cocktails...!?!? Yep, the entire right page of this simple menu is cocktails -- and for good reason. The cocktails here are just epic! And the food -- while clearly playing a supporting role -- carries the experience superbly. The appetizers are unique, delish, and fun. The entrees are very hearty portions, and with exceptional presentation and flavor.

Particulars? Too many to cataloge, but now these. The pork chop entree is simply massive -- it's actually two pork chops. Totally wonderful, but consider sharing. Shrimp and grits was the bomb. Shishito peppers appetizer was novel and fun to all. Boudin balls were gobbled up before you could blink. Heck, you could just order 2 appetizers per diner and be more than satisfied.

And oh yeah.... someone in your party MUST order a "Lawless." On my first visit, that someone was me, and I was thrilled with my choice. The Lawless is a rye cocktail that's embellished with -- ready for this? -- vanilla tobacco smoke. The cool part is not just how fun it is to watch them prep it, it's that the smoke MAKES the drink!

Blue Hound is a little pricey, but if you are in downtown and want a great meal, it's more than worth it. Next time I'm in Phoenix, I will definitely plan to eat -- and drink! -- here again.

lovely lunch spot for a meeting right in the hotel.  loved my choice of the tacos but there are other just as good.  Atmosphere good and the wait staff is fabulous!  Don't ask for sweet tea, just saying if you are from Georgia.

My husband and I stopped into the Blue Hound, just to check out the place while we were visiting for a concert.  After glancing around we noticed a lively crowd at the bar and decided to dine there  

The bartender that greeted us was named Jesse.  He gave such great service during our time here we are excited to come back and visit soon  

We husband ordered a drink called the "Charlton "  which was a smoked glass filled with great enjoyment  while I ordered the English Mule.  We were both extremely happy with our selections. Looking to order a couple bites before the concert, Jesse mentioned the Boudin Balls, mac and cheese, and ribs .  

Chasing the last little bits with a delicious IPA, we were on our way to the show.  Happy to meet Jimmy and the rest of the bar, we are excited to come back during our next show. 

Thank you Blue Hound  we will see you soon !!!!

Waw. That's all you can really say about the quality of food at blue hound. The restaurant certainly lives up to its name ... When you get your food you will feel blue... And it will look more for a hound than a human. My food had no flavor and literally came out hotter than the a Kim Kardashian Instagram selfie... She actually might have been the head chef because the meal totally lacked creativity and taste.
I really recommend this place if you love super uncomfortable bar stools, over priced drinks, and unimaginative bar food. Only gave two stars because the bartenders seemed pretty nice.
Excellent Bloody Mary's! Great service and a wonderful atmosphere. I will be back for dinner soon.

Beautiful drinks. Excellent whiskey selection. Amazing bartenders.

I've only had food here once, but it was scrumptious. I'm a sucker for gourmet-ed up southernish cuisine.
Great ambiance and selection of southern favorites. I had the fried green tomatoes with lump crab and boulibon appetizers. Delicious.

Gastropub ?
Had dinner there was some friends after a day at the convention center. The space was very nice, the service very good. While my friends enjoyed some main entrées, after we ordered a few appetizers like Boudin balls and corn fries which were both very good, I ended up having for my meal just some sliders and small beat salad. Though the sliders were very small, I was amazed at how tough the meet was. The salad was very nicely done. All the meals well presented. I would go back.  As I look back at the menu, I am not sure I would call this a Gastropub. I will continue to look for funky food !

Decided to make a reservation here before a concert in downtown.  I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the roasted chicken.   For an appetizer we went with the pork ribs.  The food was VERY good.  Not to pricey for the place but yes it's pretty poshy.  I would totally come back for dinner.

I visited the Blue Hound Kitchen during my late June visit to Phoenix.  Amazing FOOD and drinks.  The deviled farm eggs and the Prime flat iron are winners all day!  Look forward to trying other dishes when I find myself back in Arizona...    I was moved to write this review because when I reached out to the Blue Hound Kitchen to receive a copy of my receipt, the Kimpton ... Taylor Case, Restaurant Ambassador ... to be specific, not only responded to me in a timely manner, but also attached a copy of the receipt to the email.  Very much appreciated and matched what I have experienced at other Kimptons and my time dining at Blue Hound Kitchen.  So if you visit Phoenix, check both places out ... Blue Hound and the Kimpton!

This place was fun and the food was good. We went buy late  with a huge group - there were 8 of us. Our server was pleasant and knew how to manage a big group well.  I wasn't very hungry so I just ordered an appetizer: fried tomatoes. They were very tasty and came with crab meat as a garnishment. My friend ordered the salmon. I didn't try it, but she said it was good.

Let me begin by saying Blue Hound is a chic (my definition of an upscale but casual feel) restaurant. My friend and I went for the first time, and I appreciate how she searches for new places to check out and bookmarks them for us to try when I am in town.  Both her and I are foodies, so I was super excited to try a place that I had not been to before (as I usually stay in the Scottsdale area when visiting). Upon arrival I could immediately tell, the food was going to be good. The owner(s) had an upscale design for the restaurant which generally transitions to an upscale menu , cocktails and food.  I WAS ABSOLUTELY CORRECT!!  Christopher was our server for the evening and he was extremely professional, knew the menu very well, attentive and genuine about ensuring we had a good evening. Now to the food . . .

We ordered the deviled eggs to start which has a little bacon jam surprise when you bite into it, so so so good. We also ordered the pork ribs which were very flavorful with a crisp on the pork that anyone who loves pork appreciates, you must have it! I ordered the shrimp and grits and my friend ordered the blackened salmon. Let's start with my friend . . . She takes a bite of the salmon and closes her eyes like she just took a bite of heaven. Initially I was thinking, dang . . . I should've gotten the salmon . . . BUT let me say that the presentation of my entree made my saliva glands water and I was ready to dig in. TOUCHDOWN!!! I loved the shrimp and grits, but because I had inhaled the deviled eggs and the pork ribs, ordering comfort food / aka heavier food meant I couldn't eat as much as I wanted, but I kept eating until my stomach turned the "open my mouth" button off!!! The drinks . . . My friend ordered a tobacco smoked cocktail with a fabulous table side presentation (frozen glass, tobacco, the works), I'm thinking . . . Not my cup of tea but . . . She tasted it and again her eyes closed but this time supporting a "sip" of heaven. She asked me to try it, and this is a very sexy drink that both men and women will love if you like bourbons, whiskeys, scotches etc. (I don't recall which one it was) no taste of tobacco at all!! I stuck to my usual, wine and they have a very nice variety.  This brings me to the end of a fabulous dinner, because we had negative room for dessert. 

If you haven't guessed already . . . I would highly recommend the Blue Hound for any and every occasion. Thank you Christopher and the Blue Hound team for a great dining experience.
This is the second time I've been her for dinner before the theater. The food was fabulous & service stellar.
Cool place! Had breakfast, cocktails and lunch. All great.! Certainly try this if you are in downtown Phoenix. Areal high spot.

Come here with friends or family in a big group, you can "take on" on the menu, as a the pleasant server put it, when you have plenty of people to share with.

For one thing, they have excellent short ribs here! I've longed for fall off the bone ribs since I first tasted them at some hole in the wall up in Michigan during my college days. The mac 'n' cheese was a get pairing, it came out hot & cheesy, cooked with shells so it had a stuffed taste to it. The deviled eggs were also one of my faves of the night.

The outdoor patio isn't large, but they have enough sitting to fit several tables and at least 2 large parties, we picked a perfect night to enjoy the weather, so I'd definitely recommend doing the same if you can.

I've heard they've got a great bar, which from the looks of passing it appears to be true. For an up and coming area, this restaurant fits in well.

Almost want to hold back a star because of how impossible it was to have a conversation at the bar but the food was so good that I'm giving it up! Plus they were so nice about getting us a table even though we didn't have reservations. We had just planned for the team to meet up for drinks for a super casual work meeting, but it was too loud. Hey, it's a busy bar, it happens.
 I just wish places like this would invest in the sound cancelling tech that I read about in Wired mag. Not dead quiet, just dialed down a bit. 
 OK, the food, amazing boudin balls, fried green maters and shrimp grits that rivaled the stuff I had on my last trip in the deep south.
  It really seems to me that regional food is being done better outside its home turf. I noticed that in the Bay Area as well. I visit NYC for work frequently but have yet to find a better pastrami sandwich there, than the one (maybe seven), I had in San Carlos. 
 Very good cocktail menu here also. Love the creativity and balance. I had to stop at three because I hate to fly with a hangover but next time, Ill try more on the list.

Blue Hound is an incredibly relaxing and classy place to go to happy hour downtown. The atmosphere is unbeatable and the bartenders are fun! Although their happy hour flatbreads are not big enough to get full on, they are delicious. I've tried all of them, and I like them all! I like their natural daiquiri, but my favorite drink was called, I think, 'Summer Breeze' off of the happy hour, but I'm not finding it on the online menu right now, so maybe it's seasonal. 

The next thing I want to try is the pool patio bar!
Stopped by last night with a friend for a quick drink and a bite to eat and was really happy we did! Great food and drink and exceptional service!
Trendy restaurant in downtown. It was nice to grab a bite to eat and a beer on the patio in the heart of Downtown PHX. A little pricey but they have a good happy hour.

I don't even know where to start this review...every single item that I had was carefully crafted and delicious from my cocktail to my entree! 

I'd bookmarked Blue Hound on the recommendation of a colleague and jumped at the opportunity to take a friend there from out of town. The hostess who sat is was warm and friendly as she walked us to our table. We were about 15 minutes late for our reservation and had a good joke once we arrived. Once we were seated, per usual we are talking more than paying attention to the menu; however, Christopher was still very attentive and not overbearing. 

For a cocktail I had the Lawless and it did not disappoint!! The frozen glass over a tobacco skillet and the whiskey poured after was the perfect balance and was amazing. 

For appetizers, we ordered deviled eggs and pork ribs. The eggs had a sweet bacon pop in the middle that gave the last bite that WOW effect and the pork ribs were perfect. 

For my entree I ordered the blackened salmon and the fish along with its pairings just had all my senses in overdrive!!! 

I must admit navigating to the restaurant was a bit confusing at first but, I'd only knock off a .1 of a star! Now that I know exactly where it is, I should have no problems but my friend will say I'm logistically challenged no matter what!

Holiday Rip-off at Blue Hound: most pathetic holiday buffet ever. My husband and I were looking for a Christmas Day restaurant option, as it was going to be just the two of us (why cook?) but it's also his birthday. Yup, Xmas baby. So when I saw that Blue Hound had a Christmas breakfast buffet, I was excited, as the place has been on my "must try" list since we moved to PHX a couple of years ago. What a disappointment. Bigly.

Now, $36 for a holiday buffet isn't bad at all, and as it was a breakfast/brunch offering, we didn't expect the moon. When we walked in and saw the meager layout, I wanted to leave, but my husband was hungry, and there are not many options on Christmas. I figured, the food will be really good, per their rep, so we'll stay.

The scrambled eggs were like a yellow sponge from sitting over the heat. No seasonings, no add-ins, just plain ol' eggs. Next up, the breakfast sausage links were cold and gray; they didn't even bother to grill them. Nuked or steamed, they were unappetizing to say the least. Now, the applewood bacon was quite good; I ended up chowing a lot of it because I was starving - hadn't eaten anything that morning - and everything else was so lame. The third treat was shriveled, plain potato wedges. Again, no discernible seasonings, and apparently no one in the kitchen could find any onions, bell peppers or mushrooms - anything - to jazz them up a bit. And barely lukewarm.

No waffles, no pancakes. Every crummy hotel chain has a Belgian waffle maker, but even that was too much to hope for here.

The tray of pastries looked pretty sad, but I was desperate. Yuck. The Danish were stone-cold, wet and heavy. The bear claws, dry and heavy. Supposedly there had been muffins at some point, the waitress said. The bagels were standard supermarket issue, i.e., basically donut-shaped bread. Oh joy, they had some smoked salmon. How festive.

The big finale were parfaits, about 1/3 cup each, with sour, out-of-season berries and a fruit tray dominated by melons and strawberries: they look great, but are tasteless this time of year. Finished up with watery coffee. 

At least our waitress was good. Still, I was even more irked to see that a 20% gratuity was tacked on the bill. For a party of two. Really?

Grand total for all this holiday cheer: $92.52. My husband didn't want to complain, so I let it go while we were there, but on Monday, I was still annoyed that they'd wrecked our holiday/birthday brunch. I left a message for the manager on the restaurant voicemail, and of course, silence.

No response IS a response. Like the buffet, it means "fa la la la la you."

Always love coming here.  Good food,  great drinks,  great staff.   Love the central location,  especially when there are no events so the place is a little quieter.  Had a friend in from Chicago who loved the place.  It was the first stop on our circuit for the evening.

Great restaurant located in downtown Phoenix. Close walking distance to local sports and other great bars/restaurants. The Blue Hound has a nice, relaxing atmosphere and a menu that puts spins on some classic ingredients. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a different menu in the downtown area.

This was our fourth visit to the Blue Hound. The first visit was for dinner and all subsequent visits were for cocktails only. Dinner here is sub-par. The drinks, however, are excellent. Whatever your poison - beer, wine or mixed drinks - this place carries a nicely curated selection of all things alcohol. The barkeeps are knowledgeable - and can whip up a really good Old Fashioned or a Sidecar without any fuss. Highly recommended for drinks not dinner. The happy hour food menu is average.

Took one bite of the sliders and it tasted like I poured half the salt shaker down my. Luther. Additionally they were oily and dry. My boyfriend took a bite of them and immediately commented on the extent of how bad they were. The salad was also overly salty. The corn grits were not to my liking. Cool ambience but the food sucked and I wouldn't recommend it in a city with such great restaurants.
Amazing cocktails!! Great staff!! Really cool atmosphere, that's not over done, will be back!!

Reservations were made on-line, or so we thought. The reservation-maker (not me) booked the wrong weekend! We were a week early. Ooops. After being told there was like an hour wait, the manager stepped up and took great care of us. After a short wait we were seated in the outdoor patio area. 

The strange part was, while we were told it would be an hour wait, there were tons of empty tables, that remained empty the entire time. 

Upscale and young crowd - lots of black leggings. I felt kind of old and out of place. Service was attentive, but not overbearing. Food was excellent (I had the trout). Prices are not cheap. But under $200 for 3 with apps, cocktails, dessert. (I didn't pay).

They validate for 3 hours of parking in one of the Cityscape lots.

Ehhh...average at best and overpriced. We came around 630. Did not have a reservation so they said that the wait would be about 45 minutes. No problem! We planned to get a few drinks at the bar. There was no seating so we stood at this stand up area. No one bother to stop by and take our order, or even greet us. Our table was ready within about 20 minutes. After we were seated, our waiter took a good five minutes to stop by and introduce himself. The entire meal it seemed like we were a bothersome afterthought. Ordered the bacon oysters for an app. Yum!!!! I had the tagliatelle and my bf had the short ribs. Both were extremely under seasoned and my tagliatelle was super dry. Not a fan.

Great place to grab a few drinks and dinner before heading to a show or game in downtown Phoenix. It's attached to the dog-friendly Palomar hotel, so I believe you can bring your dog here, but I haven't tested it out yet. Their drinks are great and they use the huge cubes of ice in their whiskey. They also have a huge selection of whiskey, so you should definitely check it out. This place is like American tapas. So far, I've really enjoyed their cheese board, tots, and their flat breads are as good as any.

Two stars.  Because, I really have had better.  

A group of my foodie friends and I met up here in order to sort out the deets of our upcoming podcast.  The dude who made our reservation made it for four instead of five, so it took us a little while to get a table.  Not that big of a deal to me, especially since said dude bought a bottle of wine for the group to share.  

At long last we were taken to our table.  Our group nestled in to our cozy booth and perused the menu.  I already knew there wasn't much for me to eat there, as I had checked their menu online.  My cohorts ordered some appetizers: tater tots and deviled eggs.  Both dishes looked good, and everyone seemed pleased.

The service began to get a little shotty at this point. It took a while to get waters to the table and there weren't any napkins or silverware at the table until we asked for some (after the appetizers were delivered).  Two of my friends ordered appetizer salads/soups which didn't come until the entrees came.  Salad friend ordered with no walnuts, he is allergic, but it came full o' nuts. Soup friend was presented soup and no spoon.  Soup friend also ordered several items and was told that they were out (which I can understand, given that there was a Suns game that night), when plates were dropped at the table servers were VERY quick to disappear, leaving us to literally have to yell after them for the missing stuff/refills. 

As for my meal, I ordered the Citrus Marinated Olives and the Chicory Salad.  I let the server know of my vegan/gluten-freeness and he was helpful and accommodating.  The others seemed divided on their meals.  Lots of meat, that's all I can remember of what they had haha.  Eventually, the manager came to the table to apologize for all of the little mishaps and said a round of drinks was on the house. Fine by me, I thoroughly enjoyed my Tito's gimlet, thank you!  Then the executive Chef came out to apologize as well.  It was a nice touch.

All in all, I might give them a second try, but with all of the great places out there, Blue Hound might want to step up their game.

Love this place.  Great changing drink and food menu.  Took my fiancé here for our first date and we regularly get take out.  Favorites are the short rib and steal for two.  The steak rivals all upscale steakhouses in the area.

I have a few friends that Rave about this place I've been wanting to try it for a while now find it in I was little skeptical at first cuz the hostess was not very friendly to say the least had a sour look on her face overall unfriendly never spoke to us one time as we are walking to the table the server was okay at best didn't really know much about the menu ask what would a duck wings I don't know their duck I figured that much out myself and you know I'm getting probably one of the best burgers I've had in a long time pretty decent size I would say 8 oz like the bun not too squishy not too firm lightly toasted and super juicy I would say I would rank in the top 10 had to Fry's with it was not impressed really soggy and too salty no bueno a funny thing the water was probably the best one I've ever had wish I had their filtering system on my house definitely go back to the Burger maybe next time I'll sit at the bar

Had dinner here last night, appetizers were excellent, including the deviled (sp) eggs with bacon jam and the pulled pork slider. I like the choice of small or larger portions. Pork shank was good but didn't blow me away, my colleague appeared to really like the shrimp and grits. The brussels sprouts on the salad menu were a great side and delicious. The chocolate pudding with marshmallow fluff was amazing. It had a graham cracker crust. The waitress was also excellent. Very happy, highly recommended.

Good place been to Blue Hound a few times.  This Sunday went for Brunch. They were out of Short Rib Hash. Disappointing. I might call ahead next time. Party of 11 took up most of the customer service. I will visit again but I will make sure all of menu is available.

Burrata with honey, pistachios, raisins, Noble bread, and a fresh micro salad. This was especially delicious paired with an Aviation and Irish coffee cocktails. Blue Hound has some of the best cocktails around! I love the ambiance and the attention to detail the bartenders have for their elixirs.

I was staying at the Palomar off-season and spent most of my time here at the bar, sauntering in after one activity or another and only had apps to eat. Also knew one of the cocktail servers.  Fantastic cocktail bar with an antique concoctions menu and bartenders who know how to make old school drinks, bartenders were friendly and knew a lot about their trade, tools and drinks which was both educational and unusual.  Place is a bit pricey for what I think you get but it is a Kimpton hotel bar so.  As a hotel bar it did the trick, neither amazed nor dissapointed.

Went there for my birthday. Couldn't have been better. 

Atmosphere: cool and smooth, industrial and warm wood. 

Friendly service: prompt and with a smile. I asked for the bartender to order me a drink based on my meal and preferences and his selection was perfect 

Food was great: rabbit pasta with aged Parmesan that was excellent. The oysters were like silk from the sea. 

Cocktails were stellar: bartender selected The Lawless for me, and I've never enjoyed one more. 

Bonus: an amazing birthday dessert and the staff signed a birthday card for me. 

I'm not from Arizona but on my next visit you'll find me sipping on The Lawless at the Blue Hound.

My friend and I were looking for a place to have a cocktail before the Pink concert earlier this month.  Everything was packed and we stumbled upon this place.  The bartenders were friendly and attentive and my Manhattan was perfectly made.  We were in during happy hour and the price for our cocktails was very fair.  We even got to meet Pink's drummer at the bar!  If I ever find myself in downtown Phoenix, I wouldn't hesitate to stop in here again.

Service was good, ambiance is business casual, and the food was very good.  The burger was juicy and had great flavor.  We did not order any appetizers but they looked good so will have to go
back and try some more.

A bit pricey for lunch but we felt that it was justified.  Will be back for more.

Selection was very good for two couples headed to a show. Hearty pork shank or light, tasty beet salad. Take your pick. The cocktails were not a typical selection. Fresh mint or rosemary adorn the glass rim. Nice draft beer selection. 
Must mention the excellent service. Our waitress was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. She was a trusted companion right through dessert!
