Been seeing a lot on line about this place & brunch. We were in the vicinity one night & ducked in for a snack & a cocktail. We weren't sorry. The bartender was knowledgeable about the full menu & of course cocktails. So after some brainpicking we went with 2 hand crafted delicious cocktails. Our snacks were some deviled eggs that I'd read were delish & they were. So we're 3 for 3. Good staff, app & drink. We will be back for brunch. The pancakes sound amazing. I mentioned to the bartender that wanted to try the popcorn & asked him if he liked it himself. Like how spicey is it etc. He said it's a perfect mix you really should try it on your next visit. Then brought us a sample. He was right it was good. That's the kind of exemplary service all bartenders need to exude. It's all about the customer.

We stumbled upon this place taking a road trip from New Mexico to California one Thanksgiving. I'm not sure if it was because it's down the street from the Phoenix Suns arena but, it was an amazing experience as we realized that they served upscale 'soul' food and it was actually one-of-a-kind. I would definitely recommend this spot especially if you are passing through. 

One thing that really stood out to me was the bartender, or should I say mixologist!? We could really tell the difference and the drinks were amazing! Along with the delicious food, it definitely did not hurt that we got great seats and an ice skating rink was developed outside the restaurant that day! 

We were really able to enjoy not only the food, drinks and ambience of the restaurant but also experience the vibe of the town and the local families. Definitely a treat!

I had dinner here one evening while staying at the Palomar. I wasn't given the option for a table since I was dining solo, so I cozied up to the bar, which was fine by me. I had friendly, attentive service, and there is a full menu at the bar. 

There is only one vegan option, but serious props for that, as a lot of hotel restaurants lack even meaningful vegetarian choices! I had the crispy quinoa with vegetables, and it was good. I don't really have much else to say about it: it was good.. not bad, not great.

They have a huge selection of interesting cocktails, which I heard other patrons commenting positively on. 

I am not sure I would make a point to come here, but it was definitely worth the visit while staying at the hotel.

I was hired to handle a portion of a team building event late this afternoon on the outdoor patio at blue hound.  It was unexpectedly 98 degrees and in the sun. The "all hands on deck effort" to move umbrellas in to shade participants was handled beautifully, abd the manager and staff rocked.  Thank you blue hound.  Well done.  Excellent save. I trust this staff.

Good spot downtown.  Great decor, if you really like the restoration hardware look.  Service was sort of meh....we had the pork belly sliders for a starter-they were good but I didn't think they were the greatest.  I had the tucson chow da, it was good...but honestly it was mussels clams and two shrimp in a cream and pepper broth, the little fingerlings were good but seemed like an afterthought.  

The drinks were good here, very good.  The Romeo and violette was different, could easily drink those by the pint.  Margaritas were some of the best around.   

Suffered from mediocre service and an honestly not too memorable dining.  Good...but I don't think I'd go back for dinner.  Definitely would hit this place up for a drink or three.

We were very underwelmed. I had reserveration @ 7pm for 4, were seated and waited 20 minutes before someone came over and served us water and said I'll be back to get your drink order.  Another 5 minutes the assistant manager came over and started apologizing that someone would help us soon.  My husband was getting upset so she just ran got a pen and took our drink orders.  We ordered our food which was ok, we did have the couple appetizier then short ribs (good) but our califlower came out 10 minutes after we were served our ribs. Wouldn't recommend, wouldn't go back.  This was our second visit, the first time was much better.

Great location in downtown Phoenix! We had a kind server and lovely seats with interesting view, as we were surrounded by sky scrapers. Our dishes were tasty, though I found there to be some downsides...the ribs we ordered as an appetizer were flavorful, though someone in the kitchen went heavy on the salt. We also had these fried meat balls with rice inside, atop a thick tomato sauce--this was possibly the best dish of the evening. For my entrée, I ordered the Papardelle, which was good. Still, parpadelle noodles are to be wide, but, these were straight up lasagna noodles (????). My boyfriend ordered a steak and thoroughly enjoyed it, except for the potatoes which felt undercooked to him and bland. Some real hits here, but also needs some improvement

Thank you to Brian and his team for going  above and beyond to make our anniversary celebration special. Wonderful food  and service!  Highly recommend the deviled eggs, ahi tuna appetizer, brussel sprouts and shrimp and grits!

As hotel guests...I'm shocked at the level of service on a Thursday night. We sat at the bar for a good 15 minutes with empty drinks and watched the bartender wait on customer after customer that walked up next to us and didn't even acknowledge us. Will never be back to this establishment again

Yet another amazing experience at Blue Hound! I always love going there for their ambiance and creative menu items. Not only is the place great to look at, but my server was too! Chris W was very attentive and knowledgable, especially with the cocktails. I started with the Lawless, then went to the Young and Famous and finished with an excellent old fashioned. For dinner I had the scallops which were so perfectly seared, paired with the most perfect sauce! 

I heard the shishito peppers are good, I'll be coming back to try those! Thank you for the excellent service and food!

Blue Hound blew my mind!

I know it has been said 100 times, but this really IS what downtown needs. No more chains or mediocre hotel restaurants - but a classy, unique downtown destination with an honest to goodness "mixologist" running the bar.  

They offer a decent sized happy hour menu featuring about 6 of their cocktails at 6 bucks a pop, $3 beers, and $6 flatbreads,. I had a smashing good time with my Summer Smashes and enjoyed tastes of all the well crafted cocktails my friends ordered.  We were even given an ice bucket for a can of beer (classy! Like I said!). The flatbread was so flavorful and rich, even though it was a bit on the small size.  Our waiter, Zack, handled our large party very well and didn't bat an eye when we asked for separate checks. 

Nicely split sections with a lounge, bar, and restaurant Blue Hound can host a variety of different moods and a cocktail for every occasion!

While i usually don't update reviews, I feel this was absolutely necessary. I'm rarely one to write off a restaurant after the first try, so we decided to come back and check it out for dinner. We had reservations and had to move the reservation due to a delay in babysitter, and they were super accomodating. Awesome! We started with the Zucchini corn dogs with green goddess dressing. This was a really cool, well done app. it was literally little pieces of zucchini on a stick in corn dog batter. Super whimsical and a great dish to snack on. wifey jsut had the cheese plate (we DID have a big lunch)  but not me. I saw braised pork neck and I was in. How's this sound. "braised pork neck with hominy, pickled onions, avocado and grilled bread"...if that didn't make your mouth water, I'm pretty sure somewhere you just killed a smurf. And the dish was just as awesome as it sounded. It came in a litle cast iron skillet with a bit of broth. Just super tender meat, great flavor and a melange of textures. I can not wait to go back and get it again, it's the best dish I've had in Phx in a while. We also had a great server, super attentive and on point. all in all, i can easily say that Blue Hound has redeemed itself.

This spot came up during my research of tasty food, and also recommended by locals. There was a blue hound dog welcoming us next to the host/hostess station. The first area is occupied mainly by a large bar. They had a few happy customers enjoying some drinks.

They had two dining areas, one with the bar and the back room which seems to be the main dining area. The space is pretty dim, producing relaxing and romantic atmosphere.

The cocktail menu had a name and description of the drink on one page, followed by the photo of each drinks. It was nice to be able to see what the cocktails would look like before deciding which one to order. I actually picked the cocktail from the photo, since I knew I wanted one with egg whites on top. I went with a cocktail named Lion King. I loved the egg whites, exactly what I wanted! It was topped with black berry which was a bit sour. The cocktail itself was really tasty, sweet and elegant, delicious cocktail.

For food, I decided to order two appetizers as both appetizers and main, so that I can try more than one items without stuffing myself. I ordered Corn Grit Fries and Pulled Pork Sliders.

Portion of the Corn Grits was more than enough to share, my co-worker also got to have couple of pieces. It was a bit too heavy to stay in one piece, as I tried to pick it up with a fork. It was tasty but I think I had a too high of an expectation, that it didn't wow me. Pulled Pork Sliders were much better, very tasty and comforting. Really enjoyed it!  

I ended the dinner with a dessert called BHKC Pudding. It was simple but very tasty. Creamy and velvety with nice firm consistency. Nice way to end the pleasant meal.

I have many business meetings here but I am not that big of a fan. I get a burger and salad here mainly and its okay. I don't know if i would recommend this spot with other restaurants near that are fantastic like Arrogant Butcher or Hanny's. Maybe just not my cup of tea. Also i have only gone at lunch time so maybe the food is different at night but just my thought. Its a great location downtown and good atmosphere.

This place hit all my bullet points. I loved the decor right off the bat, and we were greeted with a friendly host--great first impression. Our server was incredibly helpful in recommending drinks (I chose The Darkness and would absolutely order it again). We started with the endless butterscotch chile popcorn (because how could you not?), and had a hard time selecting entrees because they all looked so delicious. I chose a half order of the beef short ribs with grits and a side of french fries, and my friend opted for a shot (yes, they offer shots, cups, and bowls of soup--genius) of their yummy cauliflower soup and a half order of the pork belly. I enjoyed both of our choices immensely, and next time I will think ahead and not fill up on the popcorn to save room for dessert.

I will definitely be returning. The great service and food was well worth it. The only advice I can give is to park underground at Cityscape (they will validate in the restaurant), and make sure you go to the second floor to find the restaurant.

Came here for a cocktail week event and was treated amazingly by the super friendly staff. The place is gorgeous, the decor ,the bar the seating and waiting areas are great. The event had us try some of their drinks that were good and and we tried their brunch. The French toast the quiche was good but the bacon was to die for the thick peppered one specially. The place is every bit as cool as everyone says it is. I'm dying to go back and try their dinner and also sit on the bar and try some their drinks of their cockatil menu. Fun place in the middle of downtown phx and I really enjoyed my visit and look forwars to many more.

This place is a joke.
Trendy- yeah. Big deal.
Service at the bar for brunch on a Sunday morning was literally shocking. Bartender didn't smile once, I swear. It was not busy at all, yet it took her 10 min to make us 4 mimosas and another 5 minutes for a bloody, because she was busy cleaning other glassware right in front of us. 

Food took 35-40 minutes to get to us and was absolutely pathetic portion size wise and wasn't even that good! She never asked us how anything was and we all left there still hungry (and broke). 

We were never offered refills on our "bottomless mimosas", had to ask every single time.

The only silver living is that a manager or just other co worker came over to us and was friendly and accommodating, since our check was wrong. I would never come back here ever again. There are so many other amazing places, especially for breakfast near this place. Don't waste your time or money!

Before a Suns game recently, my Family and I stopped into Blue Hound for some drinks and appetizers.  We attempted to go to Arrogant Butcher (been there many times), but it was packed.  Having heard good things from another family member, we decided to give Blue Hound a try, and I'm glad we did.  The inside decor is trendy and simple.  We sat at the couch by the door (since that was what was available) and were quite comfortable - except for the occasional draft from the door.  Our waitress was ok, she wasn't entirely too friendly, but she took care of our needs.

As for the food, we ordered pretty much all the appetizers.  The biggest highlight was the scones with bacon jam.  In fact, it was so good, it's inspired me to make these two things at home to see if I can replicate it.  We also had the popcorn, which was good and the sliders, which were alright.  The pizza with duck was great (could have been crisper) as was the other items we had.

Based on the previous reviews it seems this place, being new, might be hit or miss.  I'd say give it a try if you're in the area... why not?  Trust me, it's worth a visit for the cheddar scallion scones with bacon jam!

Fantastic brunch! The food was delectable; huge portions! We ordered a couple items that were unable to be prepared due to lack of ingredients but the staff went above and beyond to compensate. Amazing service and super cute birthday card for Mom. Love this place!

Visited Blue Hound for the first time with a friend last night. Very cool atmosphere. Very classy. The lighting is dim and orange, offered up primarily from vintage-style Edison bulbs hung from the ceiling. Sure enough, you're met by the statue of a blue hound upon entering.

Blue Hound was busy when we arrived at around 10:00p, but we were able to find seats at the bar. Turns out, this was the best place for us to sit.

We were helped by a super competent bartender named Bobby. It was very obvious that he loved what he was doing. The drink options were super crafty and Bobby was especially knowledgable about every topic we discussed with him.

We didn't order any food, but I would love to go back and experience their food menu sometime soon.

The drinks were costly, but you definitely get what you pay for - both in quality of beverage and in quality of service. In fact, the cocktails in particular were VERY reasonably priced for the quality of what you got.

I enjoyed my time at Blue Hound - I'll definitely be back. If you haven't been, get yourself a little dressed up and go give it a shot - you won't be disappointed. Well done, Blue Hound! And thanks, Bobby, for a really nice time.  :)

We stopped in at Blue Hound on a Friday night, surprised to find it much less busy than expected. We seated ourselves at the side bar and were promptly greeted and given menus. The cocktail list is intriguing and extensive, without being overwhelming. The food menu had a number of great options--a mix of comfort food and little plates that all sounded delicious. We went with the cheese board, which--at $22--was a bit pricey, was well worth it. It was comprised of 3 different cheeses(a manchego, an aged cheddar, and a delightfully funky sheeps' milk cheese), plus marcona almonds, prosciutto, Granny Smith Apple slices, dates, coarse mustard, pickled green beans, pickled peppers, and a lovely spiced flatbread and a soft brown bread. I ordered the Brown Derby, a bourbon based cocktail that was exactly what I'd been craving--a wonderful balance of sweet and tangy. Hubby had the Zombie, and it was the best Zombie we've ever had. Overall, Blue Hound is the perfect spot for date night--laid back but still romantic and interesting(without being pretentious), and the service was top notch.

Blue Hound do a solid meal. The corn bread and the skate were first class and the scallops were also pretty tasty. Cocktails are also awesome and have generous pours.

If you get the chance, sit out on the balcony and kick back. The view is good and given that right now PHX isn't scorching hot, its also a pretty nice place to chill after work.

Usually this place is 4 stars, but it gets knocked down because tonight our service was particularly bad. Left our table to get drinks at the bar twice, even though the restaurant wasn't particularly busy. Knocks it down to a 3, especially when I was just telling my friend how great the service is here...

Beautiful, homey restaurant, and the food is great.  The service is attentive, and the seating is comfortable.  The drawback is the noise.  This restaurant is loud!  Don't expect to have a quiet, romantic dinner here, but it is definitely energetic.  The shrimp and grips is an amazing dish, but save room for the chocolate cake (it really needs twice as much of the marvelous banana ice cream, though).

Incredible Dinner and Wine menu!!  My wife and I went here with family and all enjoyed the dinner as well as the ambiance.  The staff were friendly and polite and knew exactly when to approach the table to avoid interrupting conversations.  Food preparation time was reasonable and the dessert was amazing!

Would recommend to family and friends.  Blue Hound and Kitchen is also an ideal location in downtown phoenix if you are taking in any one of the live events that are all close by and in walking distance.

This place is OKAY food is not as good as it should be for the price. We sat for a solid 15 min before we got drinks they were slammed but not my problem. Cool place to drink but dinner was nothing special. I did have brunch here though & that was great so I would suggest that.
Short ribs, tater tots, and potato leek gratin were amazing!  Great waitstaff and ambiance.  -can't wait to go back

Blue Hound is fantastic!  We started of with the shishito peppers and they were DELISH!! Our main meal included the home made pasta, added some shrimp, and the pork shank with risotto!  The pasta was done al dente with a great sauce!  The pork shank was so tender we didn't even need a knife!!! Highly recommend this place before any event downtown! By the way, Lost melody drink was tasty!! Gemma did a great job and was on top of everything even though it was busy!!

I came into Blue Hound recently and I received spectacular service. Rob was friendly, professional, attentive, and very helpful with recommendations. I had a delicious meal and a fantastic cocktail. The atmosphere was perfect. I definitely will be back with others.

Would so have given 5 stars if it wasn't hot as hell in here. We love Jesse, Jake, and Patrick, they have made making drinks an art and we love them all. Literally the best mixologists around. The drinks are delicious just tell them what you base liquor is and they will create magic every time.

This was my second time to Blue Hound - and I am a fan.

First things first - it's a bit hard to find due to it being in the Palomar hotel. Just go to the Lobby of the Palomar (which isn't at street level FYI) and turn right. Voila. You are there. 

This was the first time I have been here for dinner, the other was for lunch. So I waited for my friend at the bar. So, for it being a pretty small bar - and I was sitting at it - it took a long time for a bar tender to come and ask what I wanted. In fact, it wasn't until my friend got there that they even asked. I would rate the bar service not so great. Another instance of trying to do side work, and not paying attention to who is at the bar. And, then we ordered two simple drinks - a glass of chardonnay and a tanqueray rocks, and that even took some serious time to get.

For starters - I would definitely recommend them. Deviled eggs are awesome, although fundamentally a little odd to get at a restaurant and not a backyard bbq. Fried green tomatoes are delish and definitely try the short rib sliders. My only issue with the short rib sliders is I am not such a fan of the sweet rolls, but the meat is awesome.

For dinner, I think I am a little hung up here. I can't say I loved the stuffed chicken. (Does not appear to be on the menu anymore.) Turned out a bit dry for me. But the accompaniments were great - cauliflower, veggies, etc. 

Overall, it's a neat place. I like the setting, I am just not sure of the food. Appears to be a southern twist - so I am thrown off by the trout, shrimp, etc., as they just aren't my thing. But I think it's a good place to go for a drink and some apps.

So...I had a hankering for the lemon-blueberry ricotta pancakes and met up with some of my pals to satisfy the craving this past Sunday.  We were greeted warmly by Sergio who kept us well stocked with coffee and water.  My pals had burrata and chillaquiles; I had the pancakes and some yummy chicken sausage.  My only quibble was the acoustic guitar and his amp turned up to 11....the interior is not conducive to the volume.  Other than that, it was a lovely morning and I enjoyed the company and the chow.
A little overpriced and not the greatest of food, but it's solid if your in town as a tourist or there for business and want something close in downtown.

Came here for Brunch and had a good time.  Service was friendly and quick.  The food was delicious- I had the French toast.  Only drank a mimosa and it was fine.  I liked the atmosphere most!  This is a great place for a girlfriend brunch away from kids.

My gal and I were in the Kimpton hotel for a quick staycation and ended up going down stairs to the house restaurant, the Blue Hound, for appetizers and drinks before heading out for the night... 

They changed up their deviled eggs and while they were good, they weren't as good as they once were. 

The drinks were serviceable but some of the other appetizers weren't what was expected. Though they were happy hour prices the portion sizes weren't what was expected.

The bartender was nice enough and fairly engaging but she was at the end of her shift and seemed a bit distracted as she was setting up for the next guy.

We'll be back... it's good enough to visit for another round of drinks... but we'll probably end up making it one of the stops of the night vs. the place we end up at for an extended period of time.

This place was fantastic! Our server Chris W. was very informative and recommended some pretty delicious picks. The pork belly sliders were so tasty I immediately regretted splitting the small portion and only having 1! My friend that joined me said the deviled eggs were the best she's ever had... and that comes from a deviled egg connoisseur. The place filled up fast for dinner and our service didn't suffer at all but I definitely recommend making a reservation...this place gets busy! Overall I would definitely dine here again and recommend it to anyone that's going to be in the downtown area.

Love the vibe. It was so nice to sit on the deck and watch the ice skaters while enjoying my dinner. The bar looked like a cool place to hang out too. Good energy. Nice lighting and decor. The food was... Pretty good. I tried a number of appetizers. The deviled eggs were unexceptional. They tried doing something interesting with this sweet bacon in there but it could have used a bit more punch and a little less sweet. The deviled fried oysters also lacked that punch. But they were tasty on their own and nicely fried. The grits they came with were an odd accompaniment. The short rib sliders were quite good. Although again could have used some other flavor - some tartness or some spice to offset the umami short rib. The Brussels sprouts were outstanding! Sautéed with a Korean style barbecue sauce. Not too sweet, which I often find to be the case. I am definitely going to steal this recipe! I will probably go back and try an entree next time.

The Blue Hound at the hip and stylish Palomar Hotel made me howl with happiness.  Will you have to drop some significant green at The Blue?  Sure. But the service on the night I visited was pristine and attentive.  Presentation fantastic.  Interesting mixture of colors, flavors, and textures all around.  I will say that the roast cauliflower appetizer was a tad too undercooked for my taste, but the combination with pistachios and raisins was an nice blend of flavors.  If you're looking for a delightfully swanky downtown dinner and cocktail spot, this place is it.

Awesome service, Sophie and Carolina were attentive and very helpful . Food, wine and hand crafted cocktails were superb. Salads were fresh, charcuterie appetizer was very filling and offered a varied array of meats and cheeses. Trout entree and pork sliders were excellent. Visited twice during our stay in Phoenix. Will be repeat customers when we come again.

Only stopped in for a few drinks but it's a nice bar! I had Bloody Mary's, my friend had the Rose all day. Patrick was really nice and talkative. He was also extremely hot. We are wondering what life is like when you're that attractive? He has a bad sense of distance though. A walk to Desoto central market definitely isn't just "down the street." Anyway, we will be back for drinks!

Well I've stayed too many times at the Kimpton to not have eaten here. But we try to avoid it. 

Food is not bad but it's not great, it definitely satisfies hunger. 

The staff has a bit of a snooty attitude, especially when you tell the the truth when they ask how your meal was. Response " could have been better". Maybe I rubbed them the wrong way but I'm not going to lie about how I was not satisfied with the way the food tasted. 

Drinks are ok

Breakfast is decent, please just stick to the waffles/pancakes (something safe) and you will have a good breakfast.

Great staff quick service and amazing menu. You need to start with the fries, Charred Pork Belly Sliders, Shishito Peppers, Hickman's Farm Deviled Eggs and the International cheese plate called Family Farmed Cheeses and if you are still hungry, order the seafood stew called Low Country Stew and/or the ribeye. If you like to drink, please order the Lawless. An amazing whiskey drink with some great aromas!

I am not worthy to write a review. 
Chief Currid I am a fan and am sure that one day you will be recognized for your superb receipes a and plate presentations. Server Jeremy you are the cherry on the cake!!  
It is a sin if you do not eat here. 
By far this is the best place.

We really enjoyed our dinner at the Blue Hound. We brought our 6 year old and felt comfortable with him. The service was great and we enjoyed a range of flavors with our meal. Easy Open Table reservations before the Suns game made getting a table simple. Ordered the cheese, meat and fruit platter to start. Nice wide range of flavors with no stinky cheese. I shared the blackened salmon with my son and my husband got the port shank. Salmon was moist and flavorful. Green beans were perfect with it. Pork shank came right off the bone and mixed nicely with the beans and rice. For dessert the fruit crisp with vanilla ice cream. There were no left overs of anything! I had to  to take away a star because it was a bit overpriced. $115 for an appetizer, 2 entrees, 1 glass of wine and 1 dessert to share.

Don't bother unless you happen to be down there with money to burn.  I have to say--that after you find the place--the look of the space is wonderful and I could see sitting and having a drink--but for the money I will go someplace else.  I made a reservation--we did not arrive together --even though other than the bar, the place was empty--they initially sat us at two different tables--i also got an email from Open Table saying the reservation had been cancelled--which I assume means that they didn't think we showed up--even though they sat the party twice.  

on to the food--the food is overpriced, small portions and underwhelming.  we started with a little, tiny bowl of mac and cheese--there are so many places in town that have taken this to an art form--this place isn't one of them.  two friends got one of the salads and didn't even finish it even though they split because it wasn't very good.  one friend ordered the chicken fried chicken sliders which they serve  on this little wooden platter--why?  they were messy and pieces of chicken were falling to the table.  I had the scallops and they were just okay--but certainly not worth the price.

on to the service--to many servers too much time --at one point there were five people providing service and at other times you could have bowled in the place and not hit a server--service was off and on and did not lend anything to the meal.

i probably won't be back--there are so many other places to go --that have really good food, great service and prices that don't make you feel liked someone just picked your pocket.
Pretty yummy and really great atmosphere. I'm not much of a dessert person but the pineapple upside down cake was awesome. Also the fried green tomatoes with lump crab were delicious!

The food was mediocre for the price. There are many unique choices on the menu but the taste does not match the creativity of the dishes. I had their New Cuban specialty drink & that was worth it. The drinks are good, so it's definitely a place for happy hour.
Ask for Rob, his old fashioned's will change your life. Came here with my now fiancée!!!!!! Finally!! A man who can drink like I can!

This place is amazing. Drinks are delicious, food is divine, service is perfect. Cute servers, cute cooks through the window, perfect lighting. I've never been to a more atmospheric restaurant. 3.5 star average is a joke. I'd give 6 stars if I could.

What a perfect date place! I didn't realize from the pictures how intimate it actually is.  

Make sure to call ahead for reservations! I made one the morning of and the earliest I could get a table for two was at 9pm. 

The service was amazing, and the drinks were even better. I had some kind of Rose infused gin drink, I can't find the name of it, but it was fantastic. All of the drinks from the menu sounded wonderful, I can't wait to try more. 

For dinner I had Roast Chicken with veggies. The skin on the chicken was so crispy I LOVE crispy chicken skin. My date had the fried catfish. Definitely recommend both. 

The only thing is I wish bread was included with the meal! It was $12 off the appetizer menu, and I couldn't get myself to splurge for it. I also wish the dessert menu was a little bit more variable. I was in the mood for dessert, but none of them were doing it for me unfortunately. 

But would love to come back! It's a great experience overall!

The Kale Cesar Salad is amazing.  The steak on the dinner menu is right on if you ask the server not to poor the salad all over it because the steak will taste too vinegar-ry and tart.  I like to have my steak served without the sides piled on top of it.  Just incase I dont want the flavor mixing.  The trout is a MUST HAVE.  The decor is beautiful and very modern (reminds me of the NE restaurants).  The servers are AMAZINGLY polite and the bar tender is the same.  The greeter or host sets the tone with a beautiful smile and welcoming warm and polite "Welcome"  Great job.

Came into the bar area with 6 people for drinks and appetizers. Great atmosphere, drink menu, and food menu! However, the bartender Greg served first round of drinks and never came back! We flagged a barback to order appetizers. All empty drinks with no attention, we asked the barback for our tab. The crabby bartender was the reason I didn't give this place five stars or spend more money.

Blue Hound has been on my list for a while now.  Finally got to get down here and have some food and drinks.  

It's on the second level just above Squid Ink.  The place was 70% empty on a Friday night so it really wasn't the best sign.  We were seated by the windows in the back corner and had our own little private booth.

The decor and ambiance is very sleek.  Felt like a really cool place to hang out.  

Our waitress was polite and took our drink and app order.  I got a whiskey sour with egg white.  My wife ordered a moscow mule.  We also ordered the corn grit fries and shishito peppers.

The corn grit fries were excellent.  They were really nothing like fries.  They were more like cheese tater tot sticks.  The bacon and cheese in them was very tasty.  The weird part was the sauce that came with them.  It was almost like a marinara sauce.  It really didn't go with the flavor of the cheesy tater tot sticks at all.

The shishito peppers were also excellent.  And the sauce with them was perfect.  I'd order these again in a heartbeat.

The drinks were good but awfully short and not worth 14 bucks a pop.

We split a kale salad as we were going to head to another spot nearby to have some food and drinks and didn't want to blow all our appetite here.  The kale salad was okay for me and my wife loved it.

Overall Blue Hound was good and in a great location with good service but I'm thinking this is more of a place to come during happy hour as it was a bit pricey for just our couple apps and drinks.

Stopped by here for a business meeting/lunch. Parking was a bit hard, but doable. 

Food was great and drinks were awesome. Service was fast, attentive, and authentic. 

Trendy cool place to go, definitely a worth while when in the area.

I keep coming back here and trying to like it more, but this place has lost so much character. It has SO much potential. The atmosphere is of a place nowhere in phoenix without even trying. The cocktails are fabulous and the food is great. However, there always feels like there's something missing. Like the place is doing just enough to get by. On the past two or three occasions I've come here, the service has been so disappointing. Mostly from the bartenders. They make an awesome drink! And that's it. No conversation, no upselling, no intrigue, nothing that makes you feel like they enjoy being part of the staff. The whole ambience is lost on them. I remember coming in years ago with a group of my friends on my birthday, we were the last and only group and we had a spectacular bartender who roused us with great drinks and fabulous storytelling/conversation. He was handsome, charming, funny, and welcoming. I never see that anymore. On Friday night, we were glanced over, unattended and brushed off, and just not engaged. The whole air inside is that no one cares. I truly think if this place wasn't attached to the palomar, it'd have closed down long ago. It pains me to think that because Blue Hound has so much potential! Its hip, its cool, it's delicious! It just lacks charisma and energy. Any time a place like this is empty on a friday night, that's a sign.

Went her after a Diamondbacks game. Came between lunch and dinner (3-5). They only have a limited bar menu during those times.

Friendly staff and nice setup.

Had the Blue Hound Burger, it was recommended by the waitress, very good. Not listed, but you have the option of having a salad instead of the fries.

Look forward to trying this place out for lunch or dinner (full menu).

Gorgeously well built bar! I loved the dark wood and open feel. It was packed during happy hour and they offer a few drinks for a decent price (i believe it was $6 a drink) and all of their flatbreads are half off. I ordered the gorgonzola one and it had a very interesting flavor. It wasn't my favorite. The rest of the menu sounded divine so I do plan on coming back soon.

Fabulous decor inside. Really cool place. They had music, ( a very talented guy on guitar/vocals ) which was great. But from the moment we sat down, the service was slow and the food took 50 minutes to be served. The restaurant was not busy what so ever, so there was NO excuse. Just another example of a restaurant  with poor to no management. It seemed like the place was being run by a bartender, on waiter, and a cook..... So much potential, but they don't take their fine establishment seriously. The "bottomless" Bloody Mary seemed to be mostly mix, next to no vodka.
Deviled eggs: Delicious, Fried Green Tomatoes: Amazing, Ahi Tuna: Very Good, Chocolate Pudding: Seriously Fantastic, Chocolate Cake: Not so good, kind of dry. Overall: Great place

I found that their HH menu contains a lot of spicier fare which I am not a fan of and its a limited menu at that.  The cocktails however are delicious still a bit pricey.  Sitting out on the patio is better than being indoors IMO.
The atmosphere is very upscale/romantic. The menu is limited but in a good way. Try the homemade pasta - it's unreal!

Such an amazing place for a romantic date night! Awesome food and extensive brown liquor list! My husband ordered flatbread and ribs and both were great! I had the blackened salmon with asparagus cooked to perfection. We will most definitely be back, prices were good and staff was great!

We came to take advantage of a promotion of $35pp for 3 courses. Due to construction we opted for valet ($10+tip). On the second floor we found Blue Hound, with a big modern seating area with a glowing fire, couches and chairs -- nice entry/first impression. 

Service was sweet but bumpy. The food runner struggled with the heavy plates and seemed so eager to set them down, we kept having to redirect her to put the right plate in front of the right person. The time between the apps and the main course was way too long. No major foils but for the price level it just should be a lot smoother. To top off our slightly fumbly meal, at the end, we were asked to produce the promotional email for the 3 course deal  -- not the  confirmation mind, but the original marketing email -- even though we followed the instructions weeks ago that stated all we had to do was email our reservation with the promo code. Causing confusion and an awkward attempt by a few at the table to take out their phones in search of the email. Weird.

But drinks came out quickly (appreciated since they aren't just two-pour deals) and the server was fairly knowledgeable about the cocktail menu. Speaking of drinks ... this place prides itself on its bar offerings and almost every drink clocked in at $10 (at least). Eep. They had a whole section for booze aficionados that uses hard-to-find ingredients/odd pairings but ... I don't know. $20 for two drinks is A LOT, especially if you're experimenting with new liquors and ingredients as their drink menu encourages you to do. 

Food pleased/impressed, for the most part. First course we ordered the mac and cheese, and the cheddar scallion biscuits with fried quail eggs and bacon jam (another thing about this place - they're on the bacon train big time, including bacon ice cream ... eh, I think everyone got over that trend before it even started); and roasted cauliflower. For mains we had a pork porterhouse, ribs with bleu cheese grits and pumpkin flatbread. The pork was good but not great, flatbread was a little boring (no pumpkin or sage flavors really popping out) and one of only substantial veggie options on the menu. The ribs were probably the star of the table - it's the size of a dinosaur bone and cooked perfectly. Desserts tried included fresh donut holes, chocolate crème brulee, treacle pudding and lime sorbet. All pretty good to excellent (though I wouldn't bother with the donut holes again, fresh but nothing special, flavor-wise).

In summary, the experience taste-wise was exactly what I was craving after living in the UK for a more than a year: that is, classic American comfort food sussed up gourmet style. But overall I don't know the food or drink prices are justifiable for a return dinner visit. However, atmosphere is modern and classy, the drinks were excellent and the care and passion put toward them is noted and appreciated - they're just a bit expensive for me. I ended up spending $140+tip for two and one of us wasn't even having cocktails!

If I still lived in Phoenix, I would probably file this one in the "only for happy hour" category, since they have discounted offerings for food and drinks.

Loved the atmosphere. Very casual chic. 

Our server was prompt in greeting us and very nice. He resented cocktail menus and I couldn't decide because they all looked delish! My friend and I started with the Desert Gin & Tonic and Lost Melody. The Gin & Tonic was extra good because it was made with premium ingredients but mine was sublime! One of those dangerous drinks that will go down easy and sneak up on ya. 

APPETIZERS: 

TATER TOTS: smoked bacon, chive, romesco sauce  - adult version of the school lunch favorite. Very tasty.

CHARRED PORK BELLY SLIDERS: kimchi, peanuts on King's Hawaiian bread - We ordered the half order (2). But after we were done, we looked at each other like...we should have ordered 4! 

DINNER: 

POT PIE: root vegetables, mushrooms, swiss chard - Pretty darn good. I didn't even miss the meat! 

BBQ'D BEEF SHORT RIBS w/ Anson Mills' blue cheese grits - One large Flintstone bone in a cast iron bowl. The meat was tender and the flavor was amazing. The taste and texture of the grits were on point too. My only "beef" was that it came out room temperature. Which made the grits congeal a little. I was very disappointed by that and felt the dish could have been even better if it were hot! 

MORE DRINKS: 

LAWLESS: Breaking & Entering bourbon, bitters, wormwood liqueur, tobacco smoked glass. Great presentation and perfectly balanced flavors. 

Finally - desert was the Pineapple Upside-Down Cake and coffee. The cake was really good. Again a classic that was on point. They must have a thing with food temperature, because the decaf coffee was ice cold! 

Our server was overwhelmed by a large table at the restaurant . We often felt like things took too long...like the food, the check and clearing out plates between servings. 

Otherwise, we had a great experience and I look forward to going back.

My last experience here was FAR more positive than my first.  I was seated promptly and the waitress made a point of asking if we were going to the concert at Talking Stick.  She wanted to make sure our food order wasn't behind a large party so we wouldn't be late - love that!  

The cocktails were delicious and my pasta was fabulous.  Had we not had to get to a show, I might have liked to linger for perhaps another cocktail and maybe dessert.

What I love about this place is that it's attached to the Palomar Hotel so you can come by and have a snack or drink, then hang out right next door in the lush and glamorous hotel lounge by the fire, and finally when you get tired of that, there's still more to do, head up to the second floor to the Lustre bar, a rooftop bar with views overseeing Phoenix. The proximity of so many neat and diverse areas makes for a very fun and adventurous date night! Had a great time, loved it all, and will be back!

Phil was excellent the female bartender however was the worst bartender I have had in years. She was so unfriendly by our entire party that we may never be back. She did however make good drinks. So give or take I guess. She would have had a way better tip with nicer service.  We did not have food so can not comment on that.

This restaurant is the bomb. The food is amazing and the service is wonderful. Good selection of food and great patio outside. If you are staying in downtown this is a must to go out and eat at. The selection is pretty slim in downtown so take an u ER and get here now!

Love this place and by far the best place I visited in the 10 days I was in Phoenix.  Staff was on top of it with menu items and drinks. Food was excellent and exactly what they said.  Don't travel to Phoenix much but when I do I will be back. Great environment and location downtown was great for me.

This is, hands down, my favorite restaurant in downtown Phoenix! Shrimp and grits! Flatiron steak! Fried tomatoes! SO GOOOOD. I mean, AWESOME! The ambiance is everything I would want in my dream home. Nice view over looking the skate rink and Christmas tree. Beautiful. Service was perfect. Definitely a place for a romantic evening, in my eyes! Excellent!

Came here for lunch and I ordered the chilaquilas with a bloody mary.  Everyone does their chilaquilas different so I had NO idea what to expect.  Well well well there people - when it arrived - layered meaty chip goodness with a fried egg on top!!!  I was in mouth watering heaven - and it was a HUGE portion, couldn't finish it.  The meat was tender, green chili was sweet and the bloody mary went so good with it all. I will definitely be back for the dinner menu - without a doubt.  Nice lunch surprise and left needing a little nap.  Thank you Blue!

There were three of us and we're seated promptly at our reservation time.  Waitress was very attentive and needed to be told to slow it down, that we were in for a lesierly meal.   For appetizers we had the fried green tomatoes with lump crab meat ( dreams are made from these - delicious ) and also the deviled eggs ( good - but too cold ).  For entree I had the shrimp & grits - had to remember my manners and not lick the bowl clean.  Also ordered by our guest was, as she called it, "The Pig", it was the chop - literally fell of the bone.  She said the gravy was very good.  A great place to bring a client or out for a nicer evening with your spouse / date.  BTW, very nice scotch selection!

I can't say enough about Blue Hound's catering service. The food was great and the atmosphere made my birthday super special. Brooke was my sales coordinator-she is a ray of sunshine to work with! She will respond to emails and your questions promptly and is incredibly attentive and focused on customer service. I cannot wait to book your services again! 
-Ro

After a so-so experience at a steakhouse the day before, I had higher hopes for this place. Once again I was with a group eating on someone else's dime, so price was no concern except as a way to judge value. 

It's nestled in a corner of a high-rise surrounded by other anonymous corporate quarters. It aspires to be more than a place for suits to get lunch, however. The menu has signature cocktails, small plates and offbeat entrees that call out to foodies and hipsters, "You're special, and we know it."

We had small plate/appetizers for the table, including roasted shishito peppers, cheese plate, deviled eggs and tater tots. I really liked the peppers and eggs, which had fried yolks as well as the usual whipped yolks. Cheese plate was a nice selection of good quality cheeses. Tots were just okay.

My entrée was a braised beef short rib on grits. The presentation was a knockout, with a Flintstones size rib poking over the edge of the bowl with the grits at the bottom. Rib was evidently roasted to finish, giving it a little char flavor, and the texture was still a little toothy, not fall off the bone tender, which is better for a short rib I think.

Service was good but cool, as you should expect in a place like this. Overall a good experience, but I give it three rather than four stars because I think the prices are not in line with the cuisine. Maybe being in downtown means high rent, which forces them to charge like this, but I wouldn't pay those prices if it were my money.

The food here was very yummy! Troy was an excellent server who shared some interesting information with us about the theme of this restaurant! Service was great and I couldn't have asked for a better date night!
Finally a bar in Phoenix that understand mixology! Great drinks!  Bar staff is friendly and atmosphere is great!

Love their deviled eggs, ahi tuna salad and old fashioned with buffalo trace! The library/den wooden oak lounge feel is equally appealing. Great place for sips, eats and convo's or a quiet lunch solo like I had.

The Blue Hound at CityScape in downtown Phoenix is a delightfully hip addition to the burgeoning Phoenix downtown dining scene. It features a reasonably priced New American (tilted toward Southern) menu, with a selection of great entrees and an outstanding cocktail list.  There is a very cool bar, that is right off the adjoining Hotel Palomar.

We split a delicious chopped salad, that reminded us a lot of the chopped salad at Citizen Public House in Scottsdale.  Not sure if there is an ownership overlap or a bit of plagiarism, but in any case, it was yummy.  My wife had the shrimp and grits and I had the swordfish entree.  Both were prepared well and and delivered promptly by our server.  Once again, both high on the yummy scale!

For dessert we shared the cherry pie, which was every bit as tasty as a pie purchased at the legendary Rock Springs Cafe in Black Canyon City, and a lot closer to home, for most of us.  Parking in the garage next door was validated, making this a destination well worth the drive from the suburbs.  We certainly will be back!
This place is great. Food was delicious, server was very attentive and it was perfect for a quiet business lunch. Will definitely be back!

Came here with a date last night, it was my first dinning experience downtown on a friday night, and Blue Hound definitely lived up to its reputation. 
We sat in the outside patio, and it was nice and cool out and more private than the main floor. 

This place has a hip vibe, and was nicely packed at the time, the food menu was way different than I expected, but most of the items we ordered were SMASHING.

-Ribs fell off the bone, and tasted rich and actually mixed pretty damn well with blue cheese grits..who woulda thought that? 

-Corn on the Cob, (mexican street style as my waiter said) were my favorite though, you gotta try this one time, the taste is explosive lol... 

-Tater Tots- bomb-tastic, better than I've had in a minute, which is saying a lot. ha

Service was strange, but attentive. Not all in your face, which could be a good thing or bad thing for some people. Our waiter was chill though. 

drinks wre str8, but not strong which was probably a good thing in my case, lol. 

Would love to support a local business like this more on the regular, and recommend it to everyone.

4 STARS.

As a native southerner, I am always a little weary to try authentic southern cuisine. Let me tell you, I was Blown Away! We stumbled upon Blue Hound by accident and boy was it a happy accident! We started with the fried green tomatoes and added the crab to it. Do it. Always add the crab! The crab was so fresh and tasty. The breading on the tomatoes was perfectly crisp and a lovely texture. Such a delicious appetizer! We then had the shrimp and grits. Let me tell you, they were phenomenal! I was taken right back to Tennessee with this dish! The grits were perfectly creamy, the sauce I could drink, and the shrimp was cooked perfectly! I can not wait to get back and try more dishes. The sous chef, Logan who created our dish so graciously came out to accept our praise on an amazing job well done! He was all but embarrassed when we couldn't stop gushing about the food! Do not leave without getting the chocolate pudding! It's a perfect marriage of thick, rich chocolate mousse on top a graham cracker crust then topped with a marshmallow swirl. The swirl is then torched to give it a bit of a burnt, meringue feel. The description does not do it justice.  Our waiter, Chris W was fantastic! When you go ask for him! Friendly and so knowledgable about the menu!

Came for "happy hour" around 5:30 today. Bar is super small and half of it is technically already Reserved. Had to grab our drinks and sit on a couch. Can't complain much though because luckily we got a spot by the fire. The atmosphere is hip and trendy, albeit it seems a little stuffy and exclusive. 
If you want a spot at the bar, May the Odds be Ever in your Favor, otherwise good luck in the lounge! If you get a couch stay and enjoy!!!
Great food, but the service wasn't good enough to make up for the rude, slow service!

The place was a bit hard for me to locate especially since I don't know downtown well, I didn't realize it was inside the Palomar hotel. The ambiance of the restaurant is chic and very eye appealing, it's trendy & unique design and furniture make it a definite posh spot for an exquisite ladies night out or afternoon catch up sesh. 

We were seated right away by a very personable host & greeted by our server within 2 minutes of being sat.  He started us with some cocktails and appetizers while we perused the menu. 

Some definite must try-
Fried Green Tomato: sounds a bit strange right, but they were surprisingly good. Up for a new treat, these are for you!
Deviled Eggs: bacon jam I don't need to say anything else 
Shishito peppers: the furikaki and aioli ... Yum!
Seared ahi salad: the bed of lettuce they used was fresh and a refreshing variety when added with a piece of the seared ahi

Cocktails- loved my dirty martini but was shocked when I tried the Lawless. The drink is made with bitters, wild turkey and this awesome smoke type concoction that adds flavor to the glass itself. Honestly, watching it be made was the fun part! 

Parts of the restaurant over look a part of city scape which can be beautiful so if ever on a date night be sure to request a window table.

I have enjoyed chef Sean's cooking for years and was thrilled when he joined one of my favorite hotels in town. Both menus have been awesome. Some of my favorites are the burrata, shishito peppers and the Ham and cheese. His soups are also great. Foh staff is always attentive and knowledgable. I would 100% recommend dining here (great scene) and staying at the hotel. Excellent staff with awesome attitudes.

What a nice little place, I really must say I liked it!
Very nice looking place, with great customer service.
I loved the scotch, over one large ice cube. Perfect for me.
Happy Hour was a nice end to a rough day.
A little hard to find parking in the downtown area here.
However, it is quite a busy place,so I guess that is why.
I had no idea downtown was jamming like this!

This place was AWESOME!  Waitress was helpful with the menu and drink selection.  We took the opportunity to sample a number of different items since it was more family style, which unexpected, but perfect for trying a new restaurant with so many wonderful items. The small family farmed cheese plate was amazing!  I'm not even a big cheese fan, but it was delish!  Next we had the green chili roasted corn.  When this came out it was still on the cob, and they happily took it off the cob for us.  Again, another amazing dish.  Then we had the Kobe Beef Short Ribs - again, wonderful!

It does look like they have changed their menu some in the last month, but I would definintely check it out!

Stopped here for a late lunch. Hostess proceeded to make a reservation confirmation call before addressing us, as in we were standing in front of her and she picked up the phone and dialed, not already on the phone. Really cool interior, and i really enjoyed my Duck and Cover cocktail. Food was just okay and served with a free side of pretension. Mac n cheese was very bland - needed an acidic element.

If your are looking for a hipster spot with good drinks and you've got money to blow this is your place. I order the lawless drink  slider  and my friend got a Salad.  Our bill was 50 bucks. Food was fair but not that good.
Food was good, service was absolutely amazing!  James was an enjoyable treat and an excellent waiter.  He bantered and was responsive and knew what was great on the menu!  Thanks James!!

Excellent! 2 of us shared deviled eggs, chopped salad and Shrimp and Grits! Wonderful! And hubby loved the scotch menu and the English Mule was amazing! This place has a great ambiance too! Perfect for downtown Phx visitors!
Had another wonderful evening at blue hound!! I've been there once before. Ambiance is like no other in Phoenix and Chris W. was amazing! Make sure to try the Lost Melody :)

Its a restaurant that's still very much in its infancy and still has some kinks to work out, but so far this new downtown spot is off to a pretty good start.  My siblings and I took my Dad here for Father's Day.  Surprisingly, it was packed (not with Father's Day peeps but rather a ton of folks in town for various conventions).  The restaurant matches well with the feel of the Hotel Palomar in general.  Modern and eclectic.

As for the food?  They strongly encourage sharing dishes amongst the whole table so they offer have and full portions of all their dishes.  For vegetarians, they have a farm fresh menu of various veggie combo dishes.  For the appetizer, we got a full order of tater tots (yes, tater tots).  Decent flavor, a little oily.  For the main dish my Dad and I both got the short rib (which is huge by the way), while my bro got the fried quail, and my sis got the gizpacho.  The short rib was juicy, fall off the bone tender with a perfect char.  My brother's quail was pretty good, but we unfortunately discovered some bones still embedded in the quail.  Not sure if it was supposed to be that way, but it was an unpleasant surprise from an otherwise tasty dish.  My sister said the gizpacho was so-so.  Overall, the food was good but not great as some dishes probably still need some work.

The atmosphere of the place and the friendly wait staff made up for some of this place's shortcomings and they even comped the appetizer for sitting us in a noisy area with the convention goers.  They didn't have to do that, but it was a nice gesture.

As a whole, I would absolutely bring my friends here for happy hour as they have a really cool bar area with a decent cocktail selection and the modern look of the place is a great conversation piece.  As far as the restaurant itself, I think it has potential.  Its only been open two weeks and I know every new place goes through some growing pains, so I'm willing to give them a pass on some of menu misfires for now.  Hopefully next time I come by they'll have worked out the kinks and lived up to their potential.
The Blu Cheese grits were fantastic! Even better the next day. Ribs had such a unique taste. Savory & sweet.

Enjoyed my meal and cocktail here.  The manhattan was delicious!  Perfect blend of rye, bitters and peel.
Salmon seasoning was delicate yet robust on a perfectly cooked fillet.  
I look forward to returning here.

Blue Hound is s great bar / restaurant.  An outstanding lounge.

The cocktails are inventive and very tasty.  The food was amazing.  I had the deviled eggs and fried green tomatoes.  They were perfectly made / cooked and an absolute delight to eat.

Excellent location in Phoenix, near a few jazz bars.  I will definitely be back again.

Very fancy schmancy for a happy hour- but it IS a hotel restaurant in downtown Phoenix... It comes with an impressive cocktail menu. The old fashioned with peach bitters is on freaking point. A great date night spot if your looking to shmoooze her. Also, their fried green tomatoes with lump crab appetizer is amazing. This place take craft cocktails and quality food to the next level.

I can't tell you how amazing our waiter James is. We had such an amazing time. James guided us through so many gorgeous craft cocktails. Seriously, order the "lawless". Stephanie, their drink MASTER, whipped up what I assume is a tobacco voodoo orgasm concoction. You will not be disappointed. 

Thanks so much for the amazing drinks, the phenomenal tater tots  and all the laughs James!!!

Came here with my wife for lunch. Visiting AZ from Portland, OR. Wife and I consider ourselves junior foodies - we really enjoyed this place. Great decor, feels very open inside. The food was good. Po'Boy was nice, wife enjoyed her burger very much. She also commented positively on her salad; fun to see watermelon radishes in it. The fries were garlic-y in the best way and seasoned generously with Rosemary. Yum. Nice to see Deschutes on tap, reminds me of home. Recommended.

Bar is really busy on the weekends even when it is cold outside.  It has a nice patio though that looks over a pretty courtyard that houses an ice skating rink in the winter in the middle of the skyscrapers.  It feels like a little bit of NYC in the middle of Phoenix.  

Bar is western/miner themed.  Crowd is more middle aged/mature.  Not a fancy bar, it is surprisingly on the casual side for the professional area it is in.

Drinks were pretty good.  Bartenders' skills are pretty high here.  Selection of alcohol is outstanding.

Rob makes a mean old fashion that is life changing. BEST service I have ever received in a restaurant!  Service was fast, courteous, and flawless.  Atmosphere was perfect. I will return. I recommend you come check out Blue Hound and ask for Rob, you won't regret it.

This was our first time to The Blue Hound. We dined here for restaurant week ,this past week.
The restaurant is a little loud,given the design of it. We could still talk,but definitely not a quiet romantic place.
The parking is $5 for the hotel valet with a stamp from the hostess stand or 2hrs complimentary in the city scape garage.
We had the farmer's market greens and the heirloom tomato appetizers. We loved them both.
For our second course we had the swordfish and the skirt steak.
Our dessert was pineapple upside down cake and the chocolate brioche.(all of this was $33./person)
There is a patio right outside the main restaurant area, but it was not being utilized the evening we dined.
Hope to be back  soon and try the poolside bar (HH) and the restaurant with the regular menu.

We went to Blue Hound because we had to wait to go to another bar. We enjoyed the drinks and food so much that we decided to stay here instead! 

The deviled eggs are delicious. I also really liked the chopped salad which was quite filling. The flatbread is good for sharing with friends. The cheese player could have been bigger, for the price I was a bit disappointed. 

I had the French Quarter which uses Woodford Reserve, one of my favorites. The Old Fashioned here rivals The Gladly / Citizen Pubhouse, but is still not quite on part with The Hudson in Sedona in my opinion. My fiancee got La Belle Fleur which is perfect if you like sweet and pretty drinks. 

I will definitely be back!

Classy place. Great section of liquor, beer and wine. Bartenders are highly skilled and can probably make anything you ask for. Prices aren't cheap though. Expect to pay around $15 for anything specialty. Half that for anything "normal" like a vodka tonic. They do have a happy hour menu though if you want to save a few bucks.
I love this place.  The food is great and make sure to order a Lawless drink.

I have always enjoyed Happy Hours with friends at Hotel Palomar's Lustre Bar so it was time to try the Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails. A friend that lives in Downtown Phoenix invited me this morning for breakfast and I accepted. For me, it's always fun to head downtown for a bit of 'Metro' fun -- there's nothing like the noises of downtown City life. Back to BHK&C, I love the decor and that it's located in the hotel lobby. 

We decided to try the Brioche French Toast & Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Both were tasty and portions were just right. & Coffee was delish! Service was outstanding. I look forward to an evening Dinner here. Oh my...their Happy Hour fries would be ideal right about now! Cheers***

Great new, hip spot in downtown Phoenix!  I was so excited when I heard a Hotel Palomar was coming and couldn't be happier with the way it turned out.  The atmosphere is hip, relaxing and just plain cool.  The bartenders/staff are very friendly and efficient.  The cocktail menu is extensive and I was not disappointed.  The summer smash was well made and very refreshing.  This will definitely be one of my "go to" places in my downtown neighborhood.

I love the ambiance of the place but the food was all very dissapointing. I brought my friend here for there birthday last week just before Thanksgiving. I'm not sure if the staff mentally checked out or the food is always so sloppily thrown together. For the prices this place charges I expect the best quality food prepared correctly. My scallops were overcooked and tasted like they had been frozen, unfrozen and sitting in a bag of water all day. The pork belly was tough and grissley. The hangar steak was burnt and had almost no meat on it, just char. The one thing that did come out good was the tator tots. 

Overall a dissapointment, do not come here, there are many better options especially for this price range!

This place is a gem of a hotel lobby bar. I'm sure they hate being referred to as a lobby bar, but it is what it is. It's owned and operated by Kimpton, but with the atmosphere and offerings comparable to other successful gastro-lounges in the  Phoenix area, I think this place would also do well if it were a stand-alone operation. Come for a cocktail, or two, grab some 'gastropub tapas', and wash them down with another cocktail, or two. 

Service at the bar can take longer than you'd like, but understandably so. The mixologists aren't just shelling out drinks, but rather, handcrafting cocktails that fire on all cylinders--presentation, taste, and price. I love the bourbon-heavy menu, with the Lawless and Old Belle being my go-to cocktails. Yea, they're up there in price, but Old Fashioneds are $6 on the HH menu Mon-Fri.

As stated in most reviews, the Kimchi Pork Belly Sliders are pretty bomb! Most of their bar menu items can be ordered in different sizes as to promote sharing and sampling of more menu items, a definite plus. 

Unfortunately, I think the bartender told me the kitchen was closed when I was there on Sunday. I think I hit the lull between lunch and dinner service(3-5pm). It was definitely a bummer. Of course I don't know what your numbers look like, but I hope you have all the variables factored into your equations. I would've stayed and ordered another drink if I had food to go along with it. One drink alone would've covered an hour worth of kitchen labor. You should consider posting a sign that says,

"We apologize to our patrons Sat-Sun 3-5pm, but our dreadful attempts at saving four hours of labor per week result in a disservice to our customers. We'd rather you eat and drink elsewhere."

All in all, 5 stars for the drinks and food (when I can get it). 1 star deducted for teasing me with a cocktail, and not pleasing me with food.

Have been there a couple of times for lunch and one for dinner.  Enjoy the vibe and the food.  Enjoy ordering several of the small plates and passing them around. Never knew I liked tater tots util I tried theirs,  My wife loved their sliders. Nice wine list with some good value wines.  Nice combination of great food and great atmosphere.  Give it a try.

We came here for a birthday party with an area that was reserved. The restaurant knew we were coming and expected a large cocktailing crowd. The problem was management only placed one cocktail server in this area and she was not well trained on service. We sat down and ordered a btl of wine, a beer, and two appetizers. The food arrived with no napkins or silverware. The bottle of wine arrived 15 mins after the food with no bucket of ice. The beer never arrived. I finally scolded the server and she brought a beer, but never brought out napkins, a manager never came and asked us if everything was ok, the food runner was the only person responsive. The food was ok but the service was pitiful! I ran several high end restaurants in NYC and would have been fired if I ran a restaurant like this place even for one night. If they do not get their act together it will be closed shortly! I won't go back!

What a seat to watch the over 45 crowd head to the Van Halen concert! Yep, that's our generation doing shots of tequila with Coors Lite chasers. 

The conversational slur: 
What type of tequila you got? (we're quite picky)
Aw, never mind that's good (too drunk to care) 

So wow it was crowded with some drunks, cool folks and young'uns.  Bartenders maintained their cool with the escalating demands... Then normalcy returned with a pleasant jibe that allowed us to absorb this fun space within the Palomar.

Menu was reasonable but bar had the most options with unusual whiskeys, oversized rocks, and signature drinks without too much sugar. Ceviche enjoyable with well brined scallops, shrimp, and chili threads.

Guess the one nagging detail was how the bar treated a young man, under dressed but paying cash...geez they requested drink payment right away then they almost double charged him for the drink when he paid up for the later  entree. Meanwhile, we hadn't even offered a credit card for our honest tab. Can't figure out that one.

Loved the oversized rocks with the whiskey and nice pours. We will be back!

I made reservations on Tuesday for Saturday night--  I had tickets to the ballet and wanted a downtown restaurant.  Blue Hound had great reviews and took reservations so I thought I would give it a try.  (Night before Valentine's Day so figured we needed reservations).  Someone called me on Friday to inform me that the chef decided to do a prix fixe menu ($80 for four courses) and that we couldn't order from the menu.  We were not interested and had to scramble to find another restaurant.  Poor planning on the part of the chef/staff.  Likely won't try again; plenty of other options.

I went to the bar for a cocktail before sitting for dinner with my husband. Michael was amazing, he was super knowledgable about drinks. I told him my favorite ingredients and he made me a fantastic custom drink, making me feel like a special guest. 

My great service continued after we sat at Nicolette's table. She walked us through the menu and made suggestions that we wouldn't have tried otherwise. She always had a smile and a welcoming attitude. We died when she brought us a complimentary chocolate cake at the end of dinner- WOW. 

We will definitely be back.

Blue Hound is a nice casual dining restaurant that is a mix of cute and rustic with all the screaming football, baseball and basketball fans coming in and out to watch TV and drink some drinks.  I dined here 2x on my trip and thought both times it was very mediocre.  The Brussels and the cauliflower apps were my two favorite things on the menu.  The Brussels were great, they were dressed with a Cesar dressing and parm cheese.  The brussels were cooked perfectly both nights.  I was very pleased with these... I really could had these for my main meal with something else small on the side.  The first night I had the scallops and they were pretty decent, I would say just nothing special.  The 2nd time around I had the seabass and it was incredibly fishy.  I am a FISH GIRL... so fishy doesn't bother me, however the seabass was just not cooked incredibly well and I didn't think the flavors came together.  I thought the atmosphere was nice.  The drinks were pretty good too!
Came in here for a quick drink and it was pretty good. It was a nice lounge feel with plenty of seating around for everyone. Bartenders were nice and the drinks were decent.

Located in The Palomar Hotel, The Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails is such a great place with a fabulous vibe and energy. The drinks are always on point and the apps are amazing! I have been here a few times and the happy hour is great.. BUT, get there early, as its tight! They do take reservations for dinner and I highly recommend since it's downtown and rather popular. 

My app loves:
The Deviled Eggs..Bacon and Jam.. YES.Please.
The Charcuterie Board...always different!
Fried Green Tomatoes with Lump Crab  SOOO tasty!
Shishito Peppers 

Great wine list and great mixology here.. sit at the bar and watch the masters mix the libations! This is just an all around great place for dinner; drinks; date night; whatever! Oh.. and I love the Blue Hound dog!

I came into town for work and stayed at the Kimpton which is a great hotel. The blue Hound is part of the hotel. I ordered the pork shank and it came out looking amazing. Great presentation but when I took a bite it was so dry and had no real flavor. I couldn't even finish it. I had some of colleagues dishes and there's all tasted great.

Overall great experience. I came here on a work trip and all my colleagues enjoyed it. 

The fried catfish was excellent. My family is southern so I'm very picky when it comes to southern dishes & they hit the nail on the head. 

The martini was pretty good as well. I asked our server for something a little sweet but strong & that's exactly what it was. The majority of their signature drinks have bourbon in them so if that's what you like, you have plenty choices. 

The atmosphere is very nice & the view is pretty at night. The service was great & our server was very knowledgeable of the menu. 

Only reason I gave it 4 stars is it is pricey. Although my entree was great, it was not worth $25.

What a wonderful culinary treat!! I took the light rail to downtown for a show and was delighted the Blur Hound was steps away!! So location is awesome!  Great drink menu, decor and ambiance was beautiful and for this "senior" delighted I could actually carry on a conversation with my dinner partner. I started with the roasted asparagus that was topped with a fried egg - outstanding!! The dressing was light and flavorful!! Terrific appetizer. I had the chefs chopped salad for dinner and added shrimp. The portion was nice, not too huge and the ingredients were delicious - avocado, dried corn, frigola, green, fresh cherry tomatoes - all fresh, crisp and delicious. Our server was super helpful and friendly. I will go back again for sure. I highly recommend this gem.

I went to Blue Hound on a whim and had a good time.  Service was great, and the alcohol choices were excellent.  I sat at the bar like I normally do and enjoyed talking to the bar tender about the different whiskey options.  

I didn't eat anything, but the food looked good (although small portions) and a bit on the pricey side.

Either way, if you're in the mood for a quick drink, Blue Hound is a great place to stop.
Chris W was a fantastic waiter. The dude killed it. Would come back and ask for his service.

This review is for the bar only.  Our bartender Bobby was great.  I put his skills to the test and ordered a lemondrop and a blood and sand (not on the drink menu). I hesitate to order them because they don't usually come out to my liking. Bobby didn't fail and the drinks were up to par! The hubby and I also ordered a few manhattans and the  the Lawless.  I'm not a smoker but the Lawless was just perfect.  Get it, you'll know what I mean.  If in Phoenix again, I'd definitely come back.

We went to the Blue Hound for a work happy hour birthday celebration.  To start, our server, also a bartender, when asked for a Manhattan with sweet vermouth, said quite sarcastically "as opposed to..."  I explained that I have had bartenders in the past make me a Manhattan with dry vermouth and I did not want that experience again.  To which he replied "That is a Brooklyn" and walked away.  OK giving him the benefit of the doubt, our drinks came and my Manhattan was very nice (everyone else drank wine and beer, so you can't really screw that up).  We ordered round two and those arrived and then decided to order some food.  And it's as if our server vanished.  Only he didn't.  He just stopped coming to our table and waited only on those around us.  Finally I went to the bar to try and get help and a bartender found a server to come to our table...while his colleague continued to avoid our table.  The food was so so (macaroni and cheese, sliders and wings).  The young lady who took over service duty was great.  But the die was cast.  This was a bad experience and I will not be going back.

The food looks good and the atmosphere is nice. I like their spin on traditional dishes. The cafe vita coffee was smooth and tasty. Unfortunately my food never showed up so after a 40 minute wait I just asked to cancel the order. Apparently the kitchen didn't notice the order so I figured instead of waiting another 20 minutes, I would simply go somewhere else.

I agree with some of my fellow Yelpers that have stated that this place still needs a little work.  I came here with 4 other people on a Saturday night and it was packed, which is always a good thing to see.  We got seated and glanced over the menu.  Our waiter came over and poured us water while we looked over the wine list.  His first mistake was that he didn't fill up our glasses of water all the way and didn't come back right away to refill the water glasses.

We ordered a bottle of wine and while we waited for it, the manager came over and told us that we would have to wait a little longer because they didn't have the particular wine we ordered chilled.  I guess that is not a big deal but we should have been asked if we wanted more water or a different kind of beverage.

We ordered some appetizers and still looked over the menu for our entrees.  The menu is not overly extensive and it really appeals to someone that likes to try new and inventive foods together. The tater tots we ordered were really good.  I would totally recommend that.  Finally our bottle of wine arrived after being chilled for about 15 minutes.

The dinner portions are really big.  I had the flat bread pizza, my sister had the sliders, and my bf had a fish dish.  The flavors were all really good.  Our waiter really didn't check up on us.  He maybe came over once in the entire time that we were in process from the appetizers to the entrees.  At this point we had ordered another bottle of wine and were enjoying the food and the conversation.  

We stayed a long time and also ordered dessert which we had to order from the manager because our original waiter was not anywhere to be seen.  The desserts were great but I would recommend to order one and share as it was enough to share with 4 people.

As we were ready to get our check, the waiter magically appeared and left us with our bill.  We had a $300 credit from an event we had held there earlier and our will was a little over $300.  The waiter acted like we were not going to live a tip based on the entire bill because he was hovering over us as we were paying the bill and stood there and looked at us until we got up to leave.  

All in all the food is good.  I think it is a place you can go once but it would not be on my list of places to return to.  I would definitely work on the service and make sure the waiters know what they are doing and make sure they are attentive.  The food can be the best but the service is what makes a customer want to return to have the delicious food.

One night I stop in for a couple drinks and some thing to eat. The food was really good and the best part of the night was the bartender Rob he  was very nice and the drinks were great He shore know how to make a drink. I will definitely be back at least you get a few drinks as long as Rob is the he really know how to make a customer feel welcome.
The chop salad was crazy good!  The trout was cooked perfect with a really smooth brown butter.  Excellent outdoor seating.
